0.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain sent to ED custody till June 9
0.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was on Tuesday sent to the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) custody till June 9 in an alleged money laundering case. This comes after the ED arrested Jain on Monday in the case, which pertains to hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

1.title: Another home irreparably damaged by violence: Omar on J&K teacher’s killing
1.article_body: After a Kashmiri Pandit teacher was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said that another home has been irreparably damaged by violence. "She lost her life in a despicable targeted attack," Abdullah tweeted. The deceased woman, 36-year-old Rajni Bala, was a resident of Samba in Jammu region.

2.title: LIC share price drops over 3% after its Q4 net profit falls 17%
2.article_body: The share price of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) dropped over 3% on Tuesday after the insurer's consolidated net profit in the January-March quarter of FY22 dropped 17%. LIC's stock price dropped 3.23% on the BSE and 3.31% on the NSE on Tuesday. The stock price has fallen about 15% from its IPO issue price of ₹949/share.

3.title: I struggle to lift even 2kg at gym post radiotherapy: Chhavi Mittal
3.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal has revealed that she struggles to lift even 2 kg dumbells at the gym after undergoing radiotherapy sessions. Chhavi added that she takes her physiotherapy classes at the gym as well. The actress further said, "I want to tell everybody going through something difficult, please just face it with a smile. It makes a lot of difference."

4.title: PMC to mark World Environment Day with cleanliness drive
4.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will mark World Environment Day this year by organising 'Plogathon 2022 Mega Drive', which will be held on June 5. As many as 134 roads in the city, as well as various hill spots and riverside ghats, will be cleaned during the drive, local media reported. The drive will commence from 7 am onwards, PMC tweeted.

5.title: Police detain 32 foreign nationals for overstaying in Bengaluru
5.article_body: In a special drive, Bengaluru City Police raided several places in the city to find overstaying foreigners and nationals without valid documents, according to a report. During the drive, police detained 32 overstaying foreign nationals, including 19 males and 13 women. All the detained foreign nationals are being questioned and necessary legal action is being taken, a police statement read.

6.title: Moosewala's father stands with folded hands as thousands join singer's funeral march
6.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh was seen thanking the late singer's thousands of supporters who joined his funeral procession in his native village in Punjab on Tuesday. Singh was seen standing on the tractor carrying Moosewala's mortal remains, with folded hands. The 28-year-old singer and Congress leader was cremated in the presence of his family and fans.

7.title: Why did Enforcement Directorate arrest Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain?
7.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Monday in an alleged money laundering case. The agency alleged that Jain was involved in hawala transactions with a Kolkata-based firm in 2015-16. Earlier, the CBI alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.

8.title: Moosewala's father holds his turban in his hands to thank crowd at son's cremation
8.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father held his turban in his hands to thank thousands of people who had gathered at village Moosa in Punjab's Mansa for his son's cremation. Sidhu Moosewala was cremated in his agricultural field instead of the village cremation ground. He was shot dead on May 29.

9.title: Ranbir's fans get crane to put garland on him in Visakhapatnam, video surfaces
9.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and director Ayan Mukerji on Tuesday flew off to Visakhapatnam to promote their upcoming film 'Brahmastra'. A video has surfaced online showing a massive garland made of marigold flowers being placed around Ranbir with the help of a crane. Ranbir and Ayan were also showered with flower petals as soon as they stepped out of the airport.

10.title: Looking forward to watching with family: Aamir on sister Nikhat's TV debut
10.article_body: Aamir Khan took to the official Instagram handle of his production house to congratulate his sister Nikhat Khan who'll make her TV debut with the show 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'. "My very best wishes to Nikhat...Looking forward to watching with my family. Love...Aamir," he wrote. Nikhat has previously appeared in films like 'Lahore Confidential' and 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'.

11.title: BJP-led central government 'adulterated', destroying economy: Mamata
11.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called the BJP-led central government "adulterated" and accused it of mismanaging country's economy. "They've destroyed...country's economy through disastrous decisions like demonetisation. It was a big scam," she said while addressing a meeting of TMC workers in Purulia district on Tuesday. She added that BJP is trying to silence opposition through central agencies.

12.title: YouTuber raises ₹33 lakh funds for temple renovation without permission in TN, held
12.article_body: Police arrested a Tamil Nadu-based YouTuber, Karthik Gopinath, for allegedly illegally raising funds over ₹33 lakh for the renovation of temples controlled by the state government without permission. He also collected money in his personal account, police added. The complainant, an official of a temple in Siruvachur, alleged Gopinath wrongfully used the money for his own purpose.

13.title: Old video of Sidhu Moosewala saying 'I am targeted, might die any day' surfaces
13.article_body: An old video of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala has surfaced online wherein he talked about death. "I don't have a specific aim in life. I have been targeted many times. I might die any day but I am not scared of death," he had said in the video. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

14.title: CCI probing alleged nexus between e-comm firms, their sellers: Report
14.article_body: Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation arm is reviewing documents that suggest financial dealings between leading e-commerce companies and their preferred sellers, the Economic Times reported. The documents were reportedly found during raids on vendors last month following allegations that Amazon and Flipkart violated competition law. The CCI arm has sought time to review documents.

15.title: I ensured that I live each moment to the fullest at Cannes: Hina Khan
15.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, speaking about her experience at Cannes Film Festival 2022, has said, "Once I was there, there was so much happening." She added, "I ensured that I live each moment to the fullest and enjoy my time there and not just rush through it." Hina unveiled the poster of her film 'Country of Blind' at the film festival.

16.title: Don't like night matches on clay: Nadal on QF match timings against Djokovic
16.article_body: Spain's Rafael Nadal has commented on the night session timings during which his French Open quarter-final match against Serbia's Novak Djokovic is scheduled to be played on Tuesday. "I don't like to play on clay during the night because the humidity is higher, the ball is slower and there can be very heavy conditions especially when it's cold," Nadal said.

17.title: Sidhu Moosewala's murder symbolic of AAP's 'misgovernance': Lekhi
17.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday criticised the AAP-led Punjab government over Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "This is not the first murder, it is the 90th murder since they (AAP) have come to power," Lekhi claimed. She further alleged that the murder was "symbolic of misgovernance going on in the state".

18.title: Water supply to be disrupted in Hyderabad for 24 hours on June 1
18.article_body: The water supply in parts of Hyderabad will be disrupted for 24 hours from 6 am on June 1 (Wednesday). The water cut has been scheduled due to repair work on freshwater supply lines, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board announced. The affected areas include Gandipet, Narsingi, Manchirevula, Manikonda and Kokapet.

19.title: Turkey summons German & French envoys over Kurdish militant events
19.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said the German and French ambassadors to Ankara were summoned to the country's Foreign Ministry to protest events organised by the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) in those nations. Turkey, US and the European Union consider PKK a terrorist organisation. Separately, Turkey has said it opposes Sweden and Finland's NATO bids for harbouring Kurdish militants.

20.title: Hardik was a big gamble by GT, Miller a massive one: Sanjay Manjrekar
20.article_body: Talking about GT's IPL 2022 triumph having beaten RR in the final, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said, "[Captain] Hardik Pandya [was a] big gamble, [batter] David Miller [a] massive gamble." "What [a] return from these guys," added Manjrekar. Hardik scored 487 runs and picked eight wickets in IPL 2022. Miller scored 481 runs at a strike rate of 142.72.

21.title: Biplab Deb's removal as CM proves BJP govt is non-performing: TMC
21.article_body: TMC General Secretary Kunal Ghosh on Monday asked the BJP to reveal why former Tripura CM Biplab Deb was removed from his post. "The removal of Biplab Kumar Deb has substantiated the Trinamool Congress' allegation that the BJP dispensation is a non-performing government," he said. Notably, BJP's Manik Saha was recently named as CM of Tripura.

22.title: After not being fielded for RS, Naqvi likely to contest LS polls: Report
22.article_body: Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi is likely to be fielded by the BJP for the Lok Sabha bypolls from the Rampur constituency, ANI reported. Notably, Naqvi, whose Rajya Sabha tenure is going to end in July 2022, has not been listed by the BJP as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha biennial election scheduled for June 10.

23.title: Unusual to have such massive snowfall: Zarina on shooting for Ishq Pashmina
23.article_body: Speaking about shooting for the film Ishq Pashmina, actress Zarina Wahab said that it was unusual to have such a massive snowfall. "I've worked outstations and experienced weather problems before, but this was something I hadn't experienced," she added. "Locals came to our aid, whether it was clearing the snow or ensuring...the areas were always clear for us," Zarina said.

24.title: 6 members of interstate gang involved in train thefts arrested in Pune
24.article_body: The Pune Rural Police has busted an interstate gang from Delhi and Haryana that was involved in several bag-lifting cases and cellphone thefts in railway stations and trains across India. Six members of the gang have been arrested. Police recovered fake Aadhaar cards, stolen cellphones, 48 SIM cards and a cutter used to break chains from their possession.

25.title: Indian-American Congressman honoured with Distinguished Leadership Award
25.article_body: Indian-American Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi has been honoured with the Distinguished Leadership Award in recognition of his outstanding career and dedication to public service. Illinois State Secretary Jesse White presented the award to the Democratic leader. Krishnamoorthi, who was born in New Delhi, has been serving as US representative for Illinois' 8th congressional district since 2017.

26.title: Lawrence Bishnoi moves Delhi HC fearing 'fake encounter' in Moosewala killing
26.article_body: A day after a court refused to entertain Lawrence Bishnoi's plea to stop the transfer of his custody to Punjab Police, the jailed gangster approached the Delhi High Court. Bishnoi, who is a suspect in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, has alleged he feared a fake encounter by Punjab Police. He is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail.

27.title: Got married too young, I understand marriage better now: Kanika
27.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who recently got married to businessman Gautam Hathiramani, has spoken about her first marriage. She said, "I got married earlier at a very young age and today I understand this institution much better." Kanika further said that sometimes one can be in a marriage with a partner who doesn't understand you, adding that it's not anybody's fault.

28.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in B'luru, drugs worth ₹8 lakh seized
28.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested a Nigerian drug peddler and seized drugs worth ₹8 lakh from his possession, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. The seized drugs include 60 grams of MDMA crystals and six grams of cocaine. Police have also recovered a mobile phone from his possession.

29.title: Sidhu Moosewala cremated in his native village in Punjab, thousands attend funeral
29.article_body: Singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, was cremated in his native village Moosa in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday, with thousands attending his funeral. As per the police, Goldy Brar, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang hailing from Canada, has claimed responsibility of Moosewala's murder. Moosewala's family has sought a CBI probe in the killing.

30.title: Hyd police detain house burglar in drive against habitual offenders
30.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday detained a "notorious" inter-state house burglar under the PD Act in a drive against habitual offenders. The accused and his associate have been robbing houses in Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh since 2017, police said. In April, police had recovered ornaments, phones, cash and a car worth a total of ₹32 lakh from the accused.

31.title: 250 coffins with mummies unearthed in Egypt, pics surface
31.article_body: Egypt on Monday displayed a trove of ancient artefacts dating back 2,500 years that the country's antiquities authorities said were recently unearthed at necropolis of Saqqara near Cairo. The find includes 250 coffins with well-preserved mummies inside, 150 bronze statues of ancient deities and bronze vessels used in rituals. The objects date back to the Late Period, about 500 BC.

32.title: Speedily hear Anil Deshmukh's plea seeking bail, SC to Bombay HC
32.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) asked the Bombay HC to expeditiously hear ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's plea seeking bail in a money laundering case. Deshmukh told SC that his bail plea has been pending for hearing since March 25 in the Bombay HC. The SC asked him to file application in HC for an early hearing of his pending plea.

33.title: 52-yr-old woman killed in elephant attack in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur
33.article_body: A 52-year-old woman died in an elephant attack in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Monday evening. The animal attacked the deceased, identified as Indarmania, near Karanjwar Sarhari village where she had gone with two other women to collect wood, an official said. While the other two women managed to escape, the elephant caught Indarmania and trampled her to death, he added.

34.title: Voting to decide U'khand CM Dhami's fate underway in Champawat
34.article_body: Voting for the by-election to Champawat Assembly seat in Uttarakhand is underway which will decide the fate of CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who had lost from the Khatima seat during state elections. "A new history of Champawat will be created today by 100 per cent voting," Dhami said. The counting of votes will take place on June 3.

35.title: Quality stocks of mangoes in Pune to be over by June 1st week: Traders
35.article_body: Mango season in Pune is likely to shorten as farmers and traders claim that the quality stock of mangoes in the city is likely to get over by first week of June. The traders alleged that unseasonal rain in Pune's two main mango procurement regions, namely the Konkan coast and Karnataka, has led to a major shortfall in produce.

36.title: Woman jumps with her 2-yr-old daughter into well in Rajasthan, both dead
36.article_body: A 25-year-old woman and her two-year-old daughter died after she jumped into a well with the minor in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur district. The woman had a quarrel with her husband and her in-laws on Monday following which she left the house with her child, police said. The well is located around two kilometres away from the house's location, police added.

37.title: My life can be divided into life before & after Baahubali: Sathyaraj
37.article_body: Actor Sathyaraj, who played Kattappa in the 'Baahubali' franchise, has said, "For me, life can be divided into life before and after Baahubali." Sathyaraj revealed that before 'Baahubali' people from South India only knew him. "After this character happened, everybody knows me," he added. The actor further revealed he does get offers to work in Hindi films.

38.title: I have seen a time when people didn't know I existed: Flora Saini
38.article_body: Actress Flora Saini has said that following the success of her show 'Gandii Baat', she was offered a lot of roles along the same lines. "That was a big compliment. I have seen a time when people didn't know I existed," she added. "Now everybody knows. I had said no to a lot of work post that," Flora further said.

39.title: SRK & I hit it off immediately, was like meeting an old friend: Farah
39.article_body: Discussing her bond with Shah Rukh Khan, director-choreographer Farah Khan said, "Shah Rukh and I hit it off immediately. It was like meeting an old friend." "We had the same sense of humour. We used to read the same kind of books," added Farah. "Aamir Khan was a big star when...[we] worked...on 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'," stated Farah.

40.title: Personally studied ED case against Satyendar, it's fake: Kejriwal
40.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that he's "personally studied" the Enforcement Directorate (ED) money laundering case against AAP leader Satyendar Jain and it's "completely fake". "We neither tolerate corruption nor [do we do] corruption. We've a very honest government," he added. Kejriwal also gave the example of AAP-led Punjab government dismissing its minister over corruption charges.

41.title: Delhi's road beautification work to be completed by Sept-Oct: Kejriwal
41.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal inspected road beautification work being carried out in Pitampura area and said that the pilot project is expected to be completed by September-October. "We are trying to beautify roads in Delhi. Our target is to beautify 500 km of roads under PWD, for which we are planning to start our pilot project," he said.

42.title: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's parents bid final goodbye to son; pic surfaces
42.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's parents on Tuesday bade final goodbye to their son at their residence in Mansa. Moosewala was shot dead by assailants on Sunday. His father Balkaur Singh claimed in his FIR that he witnessed the fatal attack on his son, saying that the assailants opened indiscriminate firing from Corolla and Bolero cars on the singer.

43.title: Sidhu Moosewala was to get married to Canadian fiancée in November: Report
43.article_body: Late singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab on Sunday, was to turn 29 years old on June 17. As per a report, the singer was due to get married in November. It added that Sidhu was engaged to Amandeep Kaur, a Canadian PR and their match was fixed around two years ago.

44.title: PM transfers ₹21,000 cr to over 10 cr farmers under PM-KISAN scheme
44.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday transferred ₹21,000 crore to over 10 crore beneficiary farmers under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) scheme during his visit to Himachal Pradesh's Shimla. This is the 11th instalment under the PM-KISAN scheme. The event, organised at Ridge Maidan, marks the eighth anniversary of the NDA government at the Centre.

45.title: 2 dead, around 20 injured after cars crash into pedestrians in US
45.article_body: Two women were killed and at least 19 were injured after two cars crashed into a crowd of pedestrians while an annual Memorial Day weekend cruise night was wrapping up in US' Nebraska on Sunday night. The deceased women were inside one of two cars involved in crash. So far, there's no evidence it was an "intentional act", police said.

46.title: BCCI announces ₹1.25-crore reward for IPL 2022 curators, groundstaff
46.article_body: The BCCI announced a reward of ₹1.25 crore for curators and groundstaff who helped in conducting IPL 2022. "We've witnessed some high octane games...I'd like to thank each one of them for their hard work," BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted. In IPL 2022, 70 league matches were held across Mumbai and Pune, while playoffs were held in Kolkata and Ahmedabad.

47.title: Ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah reaches ED office in Srinagar
47.article_body: National Conference chief and ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Srinagar. The ED had issued a summon to Abdullah in connection with a money laundering case at its headquarters in Delhi today. The case pertains to alleged financial irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Cricket Association (JKCA).

48.title: Bradley Cooper's 1st look as Bernstein in 'Maestro' out, fans react
48.article_body: Bradley Cooper's first look as Broadway composer Leonard Bernstein in the film 'Maestro' is out. Bradley can be seen with white hair and glasses in the picture. Several Twitter users reacted to Bradley's look. A user wrote, "The makeup on Bradley as Bernstein in Maestro is insane." "I hope Bradley wins the best actor Oscar one day," another user wrote.

49.title: Singer Karan Aujla pens note after Sidhu Moosewala's death, says 'I know how it feels'
49.article_body: Singer Karan Aujla penned a note on Instagram after the death of Sidhu Moosewala. "I don't feel like doing or saying anything...I am missing my parents very much...I know how it feels when a son is taken away from his parents. I can't put in words how it feels," Aujla wrote without mentioning Moosewala.

50.title: PM Modi holds massive roadshow in Shimla to mark 8 yrs of his govt
50.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a massive roadshow in Shimla to mark the eighth anniversary of Bharatiya Janata Party's government at centre. "Today is...very special day in my life. I am privileged that I was given a chance to honour my motherland," PM Modi said. "I am thankful to...all who have come in...large number to bestow their blessings," he added.

51.title: Moosewala's fans shout slogans against Punjab govt outside his residence, lathicharged
51.article_body: The police on Tuesday resorted to lathicharging fans outside the residence of singer Sidhu Moosewala at his village in Punjab's Mansa. Security was strengthened in the area as fans shouted slogans against the Punjab government and the police, demanding death for his murderers. Moosewala will be cremated at his agricultural field, The Indian Express reported.

52.title: Most comfortable being a filmmaker: Kangana as she begins prep for Emergency
52.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has started working on her upcoming directorial 'Emergency'. She took to her Instagram Stories to share pictures from her recce and mentioned she's most comfortable being a filmmaker. "Of all the roles I play, I am most comfortable in being a filmmaker," she wrote. 'Emergency' has been written by Ritesh Shah, who also penned the dialogues of 'Dhaakad'.

53.title: SRK attends friend's wedding in Mumbai, says 'She's taken care of me'
53.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan recently attended the wedding festivities of his friend, Red Chillies Entertainment Supervising Producer Bella Mulchandani in Mumbai. In a video shared by The Con Artists on Instagram, Shah Rukh said, "Bella is my oldest...friends, co-workers. The sweetest thing about her is that she's taken care of me."

54.title: Rohan Bopanna enters his first-ever French Open men's doubles semi-finals
54.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna has reached his first-ever French Open semi-finals after defeating Lloyd Glasspool and Harri Heliovaara in the men's doubles quarter-finals. Bopanna along with his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop won with a scoreline of 4-6, 6-4, 7-6 (10-3). Notably, this will be Bopanna's first semi-final appearance in a Grand Slam doubles event in seven years.

55.title: Mexico accepts US request to probe Panasonic's labour practices
55.article_body: The Mexican government has accepted a US request to probe alleged labour abuses at a Panasonic auto parts plant in the city of Reynosa. Panasonic has been accused of signing a union contract behind workers' backs and of firing several dozen employees who protested. Panasonic has said it will cooperate with Mexican authorities.

56.title: Gurugram court acquits 9 in murder case over 'poor investigation'
56.article_body: A Gurugram court acquitted all nine persons accused in a 2016 murder case over "poor investigation" after prosecution witnesses denied identifying the accused. "Benefit of the doubt is extended to the accused," the court added. "The facts...don't show...police made any effort to join the independent witness at the time of recording the alleged disclosure statements of the accused," it stated.

57.title: 30 Chinese aircraft enter Taiwan air zone, 2nd largest incursion this year
57.article_body: China on Monday made the second-largest incursion into Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) this year, with Taipei reporting 30 aircraft, including 22 fighter jets, entering the area. Taiwan in response sent aircraft and deployed air defence missile systems to track the Chinese planes, Taiwan's Defence Ministry said. Thirty-nine Chinese military planes had entered ADIZ on January 23.

58.title: McCullum will bring heart-on-the-sleeve type of play into England: Gary Stead
58.article_body: Ahead of their three-Test series against England, New Zealand head coach Gary Stead said England's newly appointed Test team coach Brendon McCullum will bring the "heart-on-the-sleeve type of play" into England's squad. "I'm sure McCullum will have some impact but whether that's right now or in the future, who knows?" added Stead. The first Test will begin on June 2.

59.title: Subhash Chandra files nomination from Rajasthan for Rajya Sabha polls
59.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and Zee TV's Founder Subhash Chandra filed his nomination for Rajya Sabha elections as an independent candidate on Tuesday. Chandra's candidature has been backed by BJP and he also met ex-Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje during his visit to the state. Chandra's tenure as a Rajya Sabha MP from Haryana will end on August 1.

60.title: Akshay was going through low phase when I entered his career: Andaaz producer
60.article_body: Director-producer Suneel Darshan who produced Akshay Kumar starrer 'Andaaz' said Akshay was going through a "low" phase, when he entered his career. "Then 'Jaanwar' happened and it worked exceptionally well for his career," added Darshan. "I had promised him...we'll do a hundred movies together," he stated. "We...managed to do seven films together, which is a tall order," said Darshan.

61.title: Ghaziabad generates ₹22 lakh revenue in May by selling solid waste
61.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation generated an income of ₹22 lakh in May by selling leftover materials such as plastic, rubber and glass from daily collection of solid waste, the officials said. The corporation collects solid waste with the help of 500 door-to-door collection vehicles in 100 residential wards. The city generates 1,000-1,200 metric tonnes of solid waste on a daily basis.

62.title: Assam to spend ₹1,000 cr on infrastructure development in sports sector
62.article_body: Assam government has decided to spend around ₹1,000 crore for infrastructure development in state's sports sector, Minister of Sports and Youth Welfare Bimal Borah said on Tuesday. "We've decided to construct a multipurpose stadium in 40 assembly constituencies...the cost of each stadium will be around ₹12 crore," Borah said. Ten district level sports complexes will also be constructed, he added.

63.title: 'Major' is an emotion, it is my life's best work: Adivi Sesh
63.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh, speaking about his upcoming film 'Major', has said, "Major is not a film that can be taken just as a film, it is an emotion, it is my life's best work." The film, directed by Sashi Kiran Tikka, is based on Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan who was martyred in the 26/11 attacks in Mumbai in 2008.

64.title: Road over bridge in Hyderabad's Kaithalapur to open for public by mid-June
64.article_body: The road over bridge (RoB) in Hyderabad's Kaithalapur will open to the public by mid-June, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) informed on Monday. The four-lane bridge will serve as a significant link between Kukatpally and HITEC city. "Citizens of Sanath Nagar, Bala Nagar and Secunderabad will save one hour of travel time and 3.50 km of distance," GHMC added.

65.title: 4 killed as German plane crashes in Croatia
65.article_body: All four people aboard a German plane were killed after the aircraft crashed near Zagreb in Croatia. The plane, which was flying from Croatia's Split city to Germany's Leverkusen, disappeared from the radar on Sunday. "As soon as the plane was spotted from above [by a drone], search teams went to the scene," said a civil defence official.

66.title: J&K Panthers Party chief Bhim Singh passes away, PM condoles demise
66.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir National Panthers Party (JKNPP) founder and chief Professor Bhim Singh died at the age of 80 on Tuesday morning. According to reports, Singh was unwell for more than a year. Condoling his demise, PM Modi tweeted, "Prof Bhim Singh Ji will be remembered as a grassroots leader who devoted his life for...welfare of Jammu and Kashmir."

67.title: Sidhu Moosewala's body to be taken for last rites on his favourite tractor; pics surface
67.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's body will be taken for last rites on his favourite tractor, the HMT 5911, with pictures of the tractor surfacing on social media. As per police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder. Earlier, a CCTV footage surfaced online which reportedly shows men who were allegedly involved in Moosewala's killing.

68.title: Germany to offer protection to Russians opposing Ukraine war
68.article_body: Germany has decided to ease the residence permit procedure for Russians who are facing political persecution for opposing the attack on Ukraine. German Minister Nancy Faeser said that Russia's aggression against Ukraine is accompanied by repression against the press, human rights activists and opposition figures. We will offer protection to those who are persecuted and threatened, she added.

69.title: Actress Dipti Dhyani shaves off her head after husband Sooraj Thapar's COVID-19 recovery
69.article_body: Actress Dipti Dhyani shaved off her head for her husband Sooraj Thapar. Dipti had pledged to offer her hair at Tirupati Balaji while Sooraj was in ICU last year after contracting COVID-19. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Dipti wrote, "Sathi tere naam ek din jeevan kar jaayenge." "She said my life mattered more to her than her hair," Sooraj said.

70.title: Mahindra & Mahindra shares hit record high of ₹1,033 after Q4 results
70.article_body: Shares of Mahindra and Mahindra hit a record high of ₹1,033 apiece on the BSE during Tuesday’s intraday trading. On Saturday, the company reported a nearly five-fold jump in its standalone profit of ₹1,192 crore for the quarter that ended on March 31, 2022, as compared to ₹245 crore profit posted for the year-ago period, it said in a statement.

71.title: Hyd woman asks 5 men to rape partner's friend over suspicion of affair, films act
71.article_body: Hyderabad police have arrested a woman named Gayatri and five men for the alleged gang-rape of another woman. According to reports, Gayatri allegedly asked the men to sexually assault her partner's friend over suspicions that the latter was involved with her partner. Gayatri allegedly filmed the incident and threatened to upload the video on the internet.

72.title: Thundershowers likely in Delhi today, clear skies for rest of the week: IMD
72.article_body: Light rainfall or thundershowers are likely to be witnessed in the afternoon or evening today in Delhi, IMD said. However, clear skies and strong winds are predicted for the remaining part of the week. On Tuesday, the maximum temperature is forecasted to be around 40°C while for the rest of the week, it will be around 42°C, IMD predicted.

73.title: Some episodes are good, some are bad: George on GoT finale criticism
73.article_body: Author George RR Martin has reacted to the criticism of season eight of 'Game of Thrones'. He said, "Some episodes are good, some are bad. Why are people getting so crazy about it?" He added, "I don't understand how people can come to hate so much something that they once loved...How has everything become so toxic?"

74.title: You made Moosewala village look cooler than any city: Pak singer Bilal on Moosewala
74.article_body: Condoling the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, Pakistani singer Bilal Saeed wrote on Instagram, "I will always remember you from your first song 'So high', a true artist and a game changer." He added, "The way you revolutionised desi music, it was a show to watch. So original that Moosewala pind looked cooler than any city in the world."

75.title: MI fans will feel the pain: Ajay Jadeja on Hardik's success as captain
75.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya's captaincy having helped his team GT clinch IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said, "If there is any pain, it will be felt by the [MI] fans." "[Hardik] is one of those who gets inspired by the crowd," added Ajay. Hardik was released by MI ahead of the IPL mega auction having joined them in 2015.

76.title: Removing ranking points from Wimbledon not a great move: Murray
76.article_body: Britain's Andy Murray has said that taking away the ranking points from Wimbledon by the ATP and WTA Tours is not a "great move". "If it doesn't stop players from playing then I don't think it's a great move," Murray said. Notably, the points were taken away due to Wimbledon's decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from the tournament.

77.title: Man drowns in waterlogged railway underpass at Delhi's Pul Prahladpur
77.article_body: A man reportedly died after he slipped and fell into a waterlogged railway underpass at southeast Delhi's Pul Prahladpur on Monday night. The deceased has not been identified yet but he was aged around 45-50 and had a tattoo on his hand that said 'Kiran, I love you,' police said. "The area was waterlogged due to heavy rainfall," police added.

78.title: Samsung to shut LCD panel manufacturing over reduced profits: Report
78.article_body: Samsung is reportedly planning to shut down its LCD panel manufacturing amid competition with its Chinese and Taiwanese counterparts. As per a report, Samsung Display will focus on manufacturing OLED and QD panels, and its employees are expected to be transferred to the QD business. Reportedly, the main reason for the shutting down of LCD panel production is reduced profits.

79.title: 12 people drown in a day in separate incidents in Guj; 1 missing
79.article_body: As many as 12 people drowned in three separate incidents in Gujarat on Monday. In Bhavnagar, four people drowned in the Rojki dam, while in Narmada, five of a family, including a child, drowned in the Karjan river. Furthermore, three youths drowned and one went missing while swimming at the Suvali Beach in Surat. One person was rescued in Surat.

80.title: Hardik Patel to join BJP on June 2 after quitting Congress
80.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who recently quit Congress, confirmed to ANI that he will join BJP on June 2. In his resignation letter, Patel had said, "Be it the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, revocation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, implementation of GST - India wanted solutions...Congress only played the role of roadblock." Patel joined Congress in 2019.

81.title: Will groom Riyan to become more of a middle-order player: Sangakkara
81.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said Riyan Parag has got "potential" and they want to groom him as a middle-order batter from the next IPL season. "Riyan is accomplished against spin as well as pace...I look forward to kind of grooming him to become more of an early middle-order player rather than just a death-hitter," stated Sangakkara.

82.title: Waqar Younis comes to mind when I think of Umran Malik: Brett Lee
82.article_body: Former Australia pacer Brett Lee has said SRH pacer Umran Malik reminds him of former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. "Umran has got a lot of pace to burn. He's a competitor, a top guy, who runs in like a lot of pacers from the past," added Lee. Umran ended IPL 2022 with 22 wickets from 14 games.

83.title: Haasan's 'Vikram' earns over ₹200 cr from pre-release business: Reports
83.article_body: Kamal Haasan's upcoming movie 'Vikram', which also stars Fahadh Faasil and Vijay Sethupathi, has reportedly earned over ₹200 crore days before its release. According to film trade analyst Ramesh Bala, the film's satellite and OTT rights in multiple languages have been sold for record prices. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the action-thriller film will release on June 3.

84.title: Moosewala’s cousin, friend out of danger after undergoing surgery
84.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala’s cousin and a friend, who were accompanying him and sustained bullet injuries in the attack on them, underwent surgery at a hospital in Ludhiana. Their condition was critical when they were brought to the hospital. "They are out of danger but have suffered multiple fractures as the bullets hit their bones," a doctor said.

85.title: Called off Azadi March to avoid imminent bloodshed: Imran Khan
85.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he ended the 'Azadi March' last week to avoid "imminent bloodshed" after clashes between his party workers and police started escalating in Islamabad. He added that PM Shehbaz Sharif-led government would've been the ultimate beneficiary of any ensuing chaos and violence. Khan also admitted that his party workers at the rally "were carrying pistols".

86.title: 36-year-old Kashmiri Pandit teacher dies after terrorists fire upon her in Kulgam
86.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit teacher at a High School in Gopalpora area of Kulgam in Kashmir was shot dead by terrorists on Tuesday, Kashmir Zone Police said. The deceased woman was identified as 36-year-old Rajni Bala, a resident of Samba in Jammu region. "Terrorists involved in this gruesome terror crime will be soon identified and neutralised," police added.

87.title: Cong leader criticises Jairam going door-to-door to give invites; he responds
87.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh criticised state CM Jairam Thakur for going door-to-door to invite people to 'Garib Kalyan Sammelan' programme, saying that his actions were "below the dignity of the CM". Thakur responded to Singh's remark, saying that he's a "common man" and questioned how he'd lowered his dignity. The programme will be held in Shimla.

88.title: Black ink, deadly attack can't suppress farmers' voices: Tikait
88.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait, who was attacked with black ink during a press conference in Bengaluru on Monday, said that black ink and deadly attack cannot suppress the voice of farmers, labourers, Dalits, the exploited, backwards and tribals of this country. "The fight will continue till the last breath," the farmer leader said in a tweet.

89.title: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh gets bail over comment on Goddess Sita
89.article_body: A Tripura court on Monday granted bail to TMC leader Kunal Ghosh over his alleged comment on Goddess Sita. "If Lord Ram is the ultimate then why did his wife Sita have such a tragic end?" Ghosh had said. Following the TMC spokesperson's comments, a chargesheet was filed against him by five police stations for allegedly hurting Hindu sentiments.

90.title: Most areas of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday due to repair works
90.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that most of the areas in the city, including Karvenagar, Kothrud, Deccan, Shivajinagar, Pune Cantonment, Solapur Road and Kirkee, will face water cuts due to repair and maintenance works. It would be restored the next day, PMC added. PMC had earlier cancelled the planned water cuts in view of the President's visit.

91.title: 44.1% of men, 8.4% of women above 15 yrs consume tobacco in UP: NFHS
91.article_body: Around 44.1% of men and 8.4% of women, above the age of 15 years, consume some form of tobacco in UP, according to NFHS-5 data. “When someone lights a cigarette or a bidi, 30% of smoke goes into his lungs and the remaining 70% hovers around and is inhaled by others,” Dr Surya Kant, state tobacco control cell member, said.

92.title: You are lucky that people treat you as relevant: Saif Ali Khan
92.article_body: Saif Ali Khan, speaking about staying relevant in films after 30 years in the industry, said, "It starts with the thinking...then you are lucky that people treat you as relevant." Talking about his looks at the age of 51, Saif stated, "I have my mum's (Sharmila Tagore) young genes...it's a cross between that and a healthy outlook on life."

93.title: Speeding truck hits workers painting road markings in Pune; 1 dead
93.article_body: One worker was killed and four others seriously injured after a speeding truck hit them while they were painting road markings in Pune's Ravet on Monday. A search has been launched to catch the truck driver who escaped from the scene, a police officer said. "The workers also got injured as hot paint splashed on them," the police officer added.

94.title: Was surprised to see RR bat first, don't know why: Sachin on IPL final
94.article_body: Discussing the IPL 2022 final where GT defeated RR by seven wickets, Sachin Tendulkar said, "Rajasthan won the toss and surprisingly batted first...I don't know why." "I believe that had Rajasthan bowled first, the pressure would have been on Gujarat," added Tendulkar. Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan had stated that RR were "timid" in their approach in the IPL 2022 final.

95.title: 2 IndiGo planes avoid mid-air collision after take-off at same time; ATC suspended
95.article_body: The DGCA has suspended an air traffic controller's (ATCO) licence for three months for approving simultaneous departures of two IndiGo flights at Bengaluru airport on January 7, which led to the planes averting a mid-air collision just after their take off. At the closest point of conflict, the vertical and lateral separation between both aircraft was 100 feet, said DGCA.

96.title: No monkeypox cases in India as 3 samples test negative: Reports
96.article_body: All three samples tested for monkeypox in India in the past 10 days have turned out negative, reports stated. "India has no laboratory-confirmed case of monkeypox so far," a central government official reportedly said, as quoted by HT. "All the samples referred to the National Institute of Virology so far have tested negative," the official added.

97.title: 8 security personnel booked for 'murdering' tribal man in Jharkhand
97.article_body: Jharkhand Police registered an FIR against eight security personnel for "murdering" a tribal man in Latehar and "destroying the evidence" a year ago. Police had earlier claimed the alleged murder was an incident of "crossfire". Police had said they encountered the tribals with arms and the other members of the group had said they carried a country-made gun for hunting.

98.title: Woman jumps into well with her 6 children in Maharashtra; she survives, all children die
98.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Maharashtra's Raigad jumped into a well along with her six children following a domestic dispute, police said. The woman survived but all her children, aged between 18 months and 10 years, died. The deceased children included five girls. An official said the woman took the step after she was allegedly beaten up by her husband's family.

99.title: Man seen throwing cash while driving car in viral video from Noida; police post his apology
99.article_body: A man's car was seized after he was seen swinging a baseball bat and throwing cash while driving the vehicle in UP's Noida. Police posted the man's apology on Twitter. "If you do stunts on the road, we will hunt. The vehicle will be confiscated, you will be in a lock-up," UP Police tweeted in Hindi.

100.title: Huge crowd gathers as Moosewala's mortal remains brought home, pics surface
100.article_body: A huge crowd gathered near Sidhu Moosewala's home as the late singer-politician's mortal remains were brought home from the hospital ahead of his funeral. Moosewala's fans were heard shouting slogans against the Punjab government and the police, demanding death for his murderers. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

101.title: Man's fight to get ₹35 refund from Railways helps 2.98 lakh people get ₹2.43 crore
101.article_body: A man, who filed nearly 50 RTI applications to get back ₹35 charged as service tax by Railways despite cancelling his ticket before GST regime was implemented, has helped 2.98 lakh people get ₹2.43 crore in refunds. An IRCTC official informed Sujeet Swami that the process to deposit refund is underway and all the passengers would gradually receive their refund.

102.title: There are no doubts, Karim Benzema should win Ballon d'Or: Messi
102.article_body: Lionel Messi has said that Real Madrid's Karim Benzema deserves to win the Ballon d'Or this year. "Benzema had a spectacular year...He was fundamental in all the matches [in Champions League] from the round of 16 onwards. I think there is no doubt this year," stated Messi. Benzema scored 44 goals with 15 assists in all competitions this season.

103.title: 2nd FIR filed against BJP's Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
103.article_body: Days after an FIR was filed in Mumbai against BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks on the Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate, a second case was registered against her in Thane on Monday. The complaint was made by a madrassa teacher who claimed that Sharma's comments on the Prophet and his wife hurt his religious sentiments.

104.title: European Council to commit $9.7 billion in aid to Ukraine
104.article_body: The European Union Council (EUCO) is ready to give Ukraine €9 billion ($9.7 billion) amid Russian invasion, EU Council President Charles Michel said on Tuesday. The council will continue to help Kyiv with its "immediate liquidity needs" alongside the G7 countries, he added. Michel called EUCO's grant of €9 billion a "strong and concrete support to Ukraine's reconstruction".

105.title: Not important, just glorified friendlies: De Bruyne on Nations League
105.article_body: Manchester City midfielder Kevin De Bruyne said the UEFA Nations League is "not important", adding that he considers the matches in the tournament as "just glorified" friendlies. "I am not looking forward to it," stated De Bruyne. "In 12 months, we have three weeks of holiday...It doesn't even matter to mention it, nothing will change anyway," said De Bruyne.

106.title: Fire breaks out at plastic factory in Noida, no injuries reported
106.article_body: A fire broke out at a private factory manufacturing plastic goods in Noida on Tuesday morning. No casualties or injuries have been reported in the incident. "The fire was reported around 4 am, prompting a quick deployment of firefighters...Five water tenders were rushed to the site and the blaze was brought under control by 6 am," an officer said.

107.title: Hyderabad Police chief meets family of man killed over inter-caste marriage
107.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Monday met the family of Neeraj Panwar who was allegedly killed over his inter-caste marriage on May 20. "We'll liaison with court officials to expedite...trials...and ensure conviction is achieved at the earliest," Anand said. In the meeting, organised with members of both the caste, Anand urged the communities to stop targeting each other.

108.title: Over 70,000 petrol pump dealers in 24 states/UTs to not buy fuel from oil firms today
108.article_body: Over 70,000 petrol pump dealers across 24 states and UTs will not purchase fuel from oil companies on Tuesday to protest against the lack of hike in dealer commission. "There was an agreement between companies and dealer associations that dealer margins will be revised every six months. However, it hasn't been revised since 2017," Delhi Petroleum Dealers' Association President said.

109.title: Kashi, Mathura not on our agenda, it is for courts to decide: Nadda
109.article_body: Speaking on the ongoing mosque-temple disputes, BJP chief JP Nadda said that contentious religious matters such as reclaiming temples in Kashi and Mathura are not on BJP's agenda. "We have always talked about the cultural development of the country. But these issues will be decided by courts and the Constitution...and BJP will implement it in letter and spirit," Nadda added.

110.title: 200 Durga Vahini women booked for marching with weapons in Kerala
110.article_body: Around 200 members of Durga Vahini, the women's wing of Vishva Hindu Parishad, have been booked for allegedly taking out a march carrying weapons in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram. A video of the march, which was allegedly held as part of arms training, has surfaced on social media. The women are facing various charges including unlawful assembly and rioting.

111.title: I wish I can be a man: 19-yr-old Zheng on battling menstrual cramps in French Open defeat
111.article_body: China's 19-year-old tennis player Qinwen Zheng blamed her French Open women's singles round of 16 defeat against world number one Iga Świątek on menstrual cramps. She said, "The first day is always..tough and then I've to do sport and I always have so much pain on...first day...I wish I can be a man...so I don't have to suffer from this."

112.title: Actress Dipti Dhyani shaves head after husband Sooraj Thapar recovers from COVID
112.article_body: Actress Dipti Dhyani has shaved her head for her actor-husband Sooraj Thapar. She had vowed to offer her hair at Tirupati Balaji while Sooraj was in ICU last year, after contracting COVID-19. Talking to ETimes, Dipti said, "I felt helpless when...doctors [said]...60 per cent of his lungs were infected...I prayed to every God...I also...vowed to donate my hair to...Tirupati Balaji."

113.title: BJP creates controversies, you stay silent: Abhishek Banerjee to WB Guv
113.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Monday accused West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of remaining silent when BJP leaders make controversial statements and insult CM Mamata Banerjee. His comments came after Dhankhar accused Abhishek Banerjee of "crossing the red line" by criticising judiciary. Banerjee claimed that BJP leaders Dilip Ghosh, Biplab Deb and others have also criticised the judiciary.

114.title: SUGAR Cosmetics raises $50 mn, reportedly at $500 mn valuation
114.article_body: Direct-to-consumer beauty and personal care brand SUGAR Cosmetics has raised $50 million in Series D funding led by L Catterton. Others who participated in the funding include existing investors A91 Partners, Elevation Capital and India Quotient. This round has valued the company at $500 million, media reports said citing sources. SUGAR had raised $21 million in February 2021.

115.title: Akshay takes dip in Ganga, performs aarti ahead of Prithviraj release
115.article_body: Akshay Kumar took a dip in the river Ganga during his visit to Varanasi for 'Samrat Prithviraj' promotions. The actor also performed puja with co-star Manushi Chhillar and director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi on the banks of river Ganga. Manushi took to Instagram to share some pictures and wrote, "Har Har Mahadev." 'Samrat Prithviraj' will release in theatres on June 3.

116.title: Tobacco kills 80 lakh people every year: WHO on World No Tobacco Day
116.article_body: Tobacco kills over 80 lakh people every year, said the World Health Organization (WHO) on the occasion of World No Tobacco Day on Tuesday. It added that 60 crore trees are chopped down and 2,200 crore tonnes of water is used to make cigarettes. "Tobacco is not only poisoning people, it's poisoning our planet," it said.

117.title: Kartik picks Rajpal in his arms at 'Bhool...' success party, video viral
117.article_body: A video of Kartik Aaryan picking up Rajpal Yadav at the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' success party has gone viral on social media. The video was posted by a media account on Instagram. A user commented, "So adorable." Another user wrote, "Rajpal Yadav is the star of the film." 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed ₹100 crore at the domestic box office.

118.title: Tourists, others organise cleanliness drive near Kedarnath after PM’s appeal
118.article_body: Tourists, government and non-government agencies organised a cleanliness drive on Tuesday near Kedarnath Dham after PM Narendra Modi appealed to people to ensure cleanliness at pilgrimage sites. "Will continuously monitor situation of waste management," Mayur Dixit, Rudraprayag DM, said. PM Modi on Sunday said if we go on a holy pilgrimage and witness a heap of filth, it's not right.

119.title: Found 100 open manholes in Mumbai, BMC creating death traps: AAP
119.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) claimed that it had found 100 open manholes in nine administrative wards of Mumbai and said that BMC was creating "death traps" for Mumbaikars. The party asked BMC to cover the manholes within a week and said, "It is shameful that every year the BMC refuses to do its duty and fix open manholes."

120.title: Monkeypox no reason to shun LGBTQ+ Pride parades: WHO
120.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) has said that the unusual spread of monkeypox doesn't mean people should shun LGBTQ+ Pride parades this summer. "Most of these events - the official events - are outdoors, they're family-friendly. We don't see any real reason to be concerned about the enhanced likelihood of transmission in those contexts," Andy Seale, a WHO adviser, said.

121.title: Hogg picks his best XI of IPL 2022, names Hardik Pandya as captain
121.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has picked his best XI of IPL 2022 with Hardik Pandya as the captain. Hogg picked Jos Buttler and David Warner as openers with Rahul Tripathi at number three position. He further picked David Miller, Dinesh Karthik, Ravichandran Ashwin and Rashid Khan. Hogg named Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Harshal Patel as his pacers.

122.title: Umar Khalid's Amravati speech in bad taste, not terrorist act: Delhi HC
122.article_body: Former JNU student Umar Khalid's Amravati speech in "bad taste" does not make it a "terrorist act", Delhi HC said. "If the case of the prosecution is premised on how offensive the speech was, that by itself will not constitute an offence," HC added. Khalid is accused under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act in connection with Delhi riots 'larger conspiracy' case.

123.title: Himachal govt announces free domestic water for rural areas
123.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government has made drinking water free in all rural regions of the state. Accordingly, no bill will be charged from the consumers in rural areas of the state after May 1 for domestic water supply. The move will benefit about 11.5 lakh consumers. Two months ago, the state government announced 125 units of free electricity to consumers.

124.title: India's import of discounted Russian crude oil touches record high in May
124.article_body: India imported a record high of over 24 million barrels of discounted Russian crude oil in May, up from 7.2 million barrels in April. India has received 34 million barrels of Russian oil since the Ukraine war began, data showed. This has trebled the value of total imports from Russia, including other products, compared with the same period of 2021.

125.title: My era at Bayern is over, no chance of continuing: Robert Lewandowski
125.article_body: Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski said his "era" at the club is over, adding that there is "no chance" of him continuing his career at Bayern anymore. "I hope that they don't keep me just because they can," stated Lewandowski. "I don't want to play there anymore. A transfer is the best solution," said Lewandowski.

126.title: Traffic police working on setting speed limits on Gurugram's major roads
126.article_body: In order to curb accidents, the Gurugram Traffic Police is soon going to set speed limits for the city's major roads. A safety audit in this regard, which is conducted by the government officials and other experts, will be completed soon. Notably, several of Gurugram's arterial roads don't have a speed limit, which often results in accidents, officials said.

127.title: Satyendar Jain arrested in fake case, to be out soon: Manish Sisodia
127.article_body: AAP's Manish Sisodia said Delhi minister Satyendar Jain, who was arrested by ED in alleged money laundering case, will be out soon as the case is "totally fake". "ED had stopped calling him for some time...Now, it has again started calling him because he is the (AAP) incharge of the Himachal polls," he added.

128.title: Russia suspends gas supplies to Dutch govt-owned power firm
128.article_body: Russia's Gazprom has decided to suspend its gas supplies to the Dutch government-owned power firm GasTerra from Tuesday (May 31) after the latter refused to make payment in roubles. However, the Dutch government said the move will have "no consequences [on] the physical delivery of gas to Dutch households". GasTerra said it has secured a gas deal elsewhere.

129.title: UP govt will file cases against farmers who abandon cows: Minister
129.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Dharam Pal Singh said in the state Assembly on Monday that CM Yogi Adityanath-led government has enacted a law to register cases against farmers who abandon cows. "There is a difference between 'kasai and kisan' (butcher and farmer). We will care for the farmer, not the butcher," he added. Furthermore, he said that cows "aren't stray animals".

130.title: Canada plans to ban handgun sales in wake of Texas school shooting
130.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's government has introduced legislation that would put a freeze on importing, buying or selling handguns. "Other than using firearms for sport shooting and hunting, there's no reason anyone in Canada should need guns in their everyday lives," Trudeau said. The legislation comes days after a gunman killed 19 children at an elementary school in US' Texas.

131.title: He's the 'Don' of Indian cinema: Actor Sivakarthikeyan on Rajinikanth
131.article_body: Tamil actor Sivakarthikeyan tweeted that actor Rajinikanth is the "Don" of Indian cinema, adding he is a "superstar". Sivakarthikeyan spent an hour with Rajinikanth recently with the former terming those 60 minutes as a "lifetime" memory. "Thank you so much Thalaiva for your time and valuable [appreciation] for 'Don'," added Sivakarthikeyan in his tweet. He was recently seen in 'Don'.

132.title: Men were represented badly in the 80s & 90s films: Zoya Akhtar
132.article_body: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar said men were "represented badly" in the 1980s and 1990s films. "In the 80s...90s...you never saw consent. But we had molestation scenes. That affects the psyche of a nation," she stated. Zoya added films showed women that had no right to express their feelings. "How you're representing is key...people need to know they're not alone," she said.

133.title: High inflation, financial mismanagement synonymous with Modi govt's 8 yrs: TMC
133.article_body: The Trinamool Congress criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government, which completed its eight years on Monday, and said that mismanagement of economy and high inflation have been "synonymous" with eight years of Modi regime at Centre. TMC further said that Modi government has "failed on all fronts" and added that the Constitution is constantly "undermined" and "disregarded" in PM Modi's regime.

134.title: PM Modi has changed culture of Indian politics in 8 years: JP Nadda
134.article_body: Addressing a press conference to mark eight years of the Modi government in India, BJP President JP Nadda said, "PM Modi has changed the culture of Indian politics." "Seva, sushasan and garib kalyan (service, good governance and welfare of poor) are the soul of the Modi government," he added. "Today, we see a responsible, proactive, accountable government," Nadda said.

135.title: Irfan Pathan names his Best XI of IPL 2022, includes Hardik Pandya as captain
135.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has named his Best XI of IPL 2022, including GT skipper Hardik Pandya as the captain. He named Jos Buttler and KL Rahul as the openers, while he included Sanju Samson as the wicketkeeper. Other players include Liam Livingstone, David Miller, Rashid Khan, Harshal Patel, Mohammad Shami, Umran Malik and Yuzvendra Chahal.

136.title: India reports 2,338 new COVID-19 cases, 19 deaths in last 24 hours
136.article_body: India has reported 2,338 COVID-19 cases, 2,134 recoveries and 19 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,706 COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,883, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,630.

137.title: Who smashed the most sixes in IPL 2022 and who hit the most fours?
137.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler smashed the most number of sixes in IPL 2022 with 45 maximums. Buttler also hit the most fours (83). PBKS' Liam Livingstone followed Buttler with 34 sixes, while KKR all-rounder Andre Russell slammed 32 sixes. Meanwhile, David Warner hit the second-most number of fours at 52, followed by GT's Shubman Gill (51).

138.title: Man jailed for harassing wife over more dowry: Rachakonda Police
138.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Monday that a 25-year-old man was sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment on charges of mentally and physically harassing his 24-year-old wife for additional dowry. The accused, who is addicted to alcohol, was previously taken to the panchayat over the harassment by the woman's family but he didn't change his attitude, the police added.

139.title: 7 die in ambulance-truck collision in UP; 6 were returning after check-up
139.article_body: At least seven people died as an ambulance collided with a truck in the Fatehganj Police Station area in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Tuesday. Six of the deceased were returning from Delhi following a check-up. Reportedly, there were three women and four men among the deceased. CM Yogi Adityanath expressed condolences on the loss of lives in the accident.

140.title: EU agrees to ban majority of Russian oil imports amid Ukraine war
140.article_body: The European Union has agreed to partially ban Russian oil imports, said EU Council President Charles Michel. "This would cover more than 2/3 of Russian oil imports, cutting a huge source of financing for its war machine," tweeted Michel. Europe is the biggest buyer of Russian energy. Russian crude accounted for 27% of its imports in 2021, according to Eurostat.

141.title: Stray dog run over by car in Bengaluru; act caught on CCTV
141.article_body: Police have launched an investigation after a stray dog was run over by a car in Bengaluru's Jayanagar. The incident, captured on CCTV footage, occurred on May 27. According to reports, a complaint was filed by a person who runs a milk booth in the neighbourhood and had been taking care of the dog, who died immediately after the incident.

142.title: 35-yr-old man robbed at gunpoint in Greater Noida, FIR lodged after 6 days
142.article_body: An FIR was registered against unidentified assailants for robbing and attacking a Greater Noida (west) resident, Jyotindra Dubey (35), on May 23. The assailants had hit Dubey with a gun and fled after taking away his mobile. The complainant was discharged from the hospital on May 26 and police received the complaint on May 29, officials said.

143.title: 57 injured as tourist bus collides with KSRTC bus in Kerala's Kollam
143.article_body: At least 57 people were injured after a tourist bus collided with a Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus on Kulathupuzha-Madathara road in Kerala's Kollam, police said. The condition of one of the victims is serious, state Health Minister Veena George said. She added that 42 injured persons have been admitted to Thiruvananthapuram's Government Medical College Hospital.

144.title: 2 terrorists killed in Kashmir; one of them linked to civilian killings
144.article_body: Two terrorists have been killed in an encounter with security forces in Awantipora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Tuesday. The killed terrorists were identified as Shahid Rather of Tral and Umar Yousuf of Shopian, police said. Shahid was involved in two civilian killings including that of a woman and a government employee, police added.

145.title: 10-yr-old US boy sends pic of 4 assault rifles, talks about mass shooting; arrested
145.article_body: Police in US' Florida have posted the video of the arrest of a 10-year-old boy who allegedly threatened a mass shooting at his elementary school. Daniel Marquez allegedly shared an image of four assault rifles he said he bought. The boy was charged as a juvenile with making a written threat to conduct a mass shooting, police said.

146.title: World no. 2 Medvedev knocked out of French Open by Cilic
146.article_body: World number two Daniil Medvedev was knocked out of the French Open after suffering defeat against Croatian Marin Cilic in the fourth round. Cilic, who has now reached the Roland Garros quarter-finals for the third time, defeated Medvedev 6-2, 6-3, 6-2. Earlier, world number four Stefanos Tsitsipas crashed out of the tournament after his fourth-round defeat against Holger Rune.

147.title: He's in good health: Russian minister on Putin after 'he has 3 years to live' claim
147.article_body: After a Russian intelligence officer was quoted as saying in reports that Vladimir Putin has been given "three years to live" as he has a "rapidly progressive cancer", Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said the country's leader is in good health. Lavrov further said that Putin is "not suffering from any ailments" and that he "appears in public every day".

148.title: As a father, I can't not think about the kids: Nick on Texas shooting
148.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas has said the mass shooting incident in a Texas school and similar incidents are harder for him as he has become a father. "As a father, as an uncle, I can't not think about the kids and all the lives that were lost," Nick stated. Nineteen children and two adults were killed in the Texas shooting.

149.title: Playing Komolika was heavy, had to kill a newborn in a scene: Aamna
149.article_body: Actress Aamna Sharif has said it was "very heavy" to play Komolika in 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay 2'. She added that she had to kill a newborn in a scene which "played" with her mental health. "While it was challenging, it also gave me...push that I should do it. The idea was to come out of my comfort zone," Aamna said.

150.title: Robber gang busted in Jhansi; 17-yr-old girl among 5 arrested
150.article_body: Jhansi Police on Monday busted an inter-district gang of robbers and arrested five persons, including a 17-year-old girl. According to police, the girl, whose father is a history-sheeter and currently lodged in jail, would help robbers in disposing of looted materials and give them logistic support. She told police she joined robbers to arrange money for her father's legal expenses.

151.title: 40-yr-old woman arrested for kidnapping 3-yr-old girl from Pune
151.article_body: Police have rescued a three-year-old girl who was allegedly kidnapped by a 40-year-old woman from Pune last week. The woman, who was arrested on Monday, wanted to earn money by making the child beg and taking dowry for her marriage, according to police. The accused, who's from Ahmednagar, was traced using retailer's name on her bag, a police officer said.

152.title: M&M to sell its entire stake in TVS Automobile Solutions for ₹45 crore
152.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra has announced it will sell its entire 2.76% stake in TVS Automobile Solutions Private Limited (TASPL). It added that following the sale, its holding in TASPL would become nil and it would receive ₹45 crore from the deal. In TASPL, M&M holds 3,32,195 equity shares of ₹10 each and 100 Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares of ₹10 each.

153.title: Had no films for 3-4 years before 'Munna Bhai MBBS', I was gone: Arshad
153.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi said he doesn't think the third instalment of the 'Munna Bhai' franchise will be made. "I wish it would, that we could have a proper closure," added Arshad. Arshad stated he had no films for three to four years before the Sanjay Dutt starrer 'Munna Bhai MBBS', adding that he was out of sight and "gone".

154.title: BBMP asked to modernise slaughterhouse to keep Ulsoor lake clean
154.article_body: A panel appointed by National Green Tribunal (NGT) to examine the causes of pollution in Bengaluru's Ulsoor lake has asked the civic body, BBMP, to modernise its slaughterhouse located on Tannery Road. The panel gave a deadline of March 31, 2024 to do so. It had earlier said that untreated discharge from the slaughterhouse enters the lake through the drains.

155.title: Bengaluru reports 159 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Karnataka
155.article_body: Bengaluru reported 159 new COVID-19 cases on Monday, the highest in Karnataka. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the city reported 93 recoveries and zero deaths related to the virus on Monday. With 2,009 active cases, the positivity rate in Bengaluru currently stands at 1.28%, data showed. Notably, Karnataka reported 166 new COVID-19 cases on Monday.

156.title: B'luru's mango, jackfruit fair returns after 2-yr pandemic hiatus
156.article_body: The annual mango and jackfruit fair is being held in Bengaluru after a gap of two years as it was put on hold over the COVID-19 pandemic. The fair started on May 27 and is scheduled to continue till June 13. As many as 30 to 40 varieties of mango and 10 to 12 of jackfruit are on display.

157.title: 1 killed as Taiwan Air Force jet crashes; 2nd fatal accident this year
157.article_body: A Taiwanese jet crashed on Tuesday during a training mission, killing the pilot, the Defence Ministry said. This is the second fatal accident the island's Air Force has experienced this year. Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen has ordered an investigation into the incident, her office said. In January, a pilot was killed after an F-16 fighter jet crashed into the sea.

158.title: All 22 bodies including that of 4 Indians recovered from Nepal plane crash site
158.article_body: The rescue officers on Tuesday said all 22 bodies were recovered from the wreckage of the Tara Air flight which crashed in Nepal's Mustang on Sunday, ANI reported. The aircraft was also hosting a family of four Indians including Ashok Tripathi, his ex-wife Vaibhavi Tripathi and their two children. The rescue officers added that the black box was also retrieved.

159.title: 10-yr-old US boy sends pic of 4 assault rifles, talks about mass shooting; arrested
159.article_body: Police in US' Florida have posted the video of the arrest of a 10-year-old boy who allegedly threatened a mass shooting at his elementary school. Daniel Marquez allegedly shared an image of four assault rifles he said he bought. The boy was charged as a juvenile with making a written threat to conduct a mass shooting, police said.

160.title: If speaking against Savarkar is anti-national then put me in jail: Cong leader
160.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said if speaking against Veer Savarkar is anti-national, then he should be put in jail. "BJP is saying that if anyone speaks against Veer Savarkar then he is an anti-national. Yes, I am saying I am speaking against him. If I am anti-national, arrest me and put me behind bars," he added.

161.title: 5 Pune minors detained in attempt to murder case over social media post
161.article_body: Police detained five minors, aged around seventeen years, in an attempt to murder case over a social media post by a 16-year-old boy in Pune's Ghule Nagar. The victim was at an ATM when the accused attacked him from behind with an iron scythe and also threatened to kill him for posting a threatening status on social media, police said.

162.title: Sachin Tendulkar names his Team of IPL 2022
162.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar named his Team of IPL 2022. Sachin has named GT skipper Hardik Pandya as the captain of his side. He has included RCB's Dinesh Karthik as the wicketkeeper. His four foreign players include Jos Buttler, David Miller, Liam Livingstone and Rashid Khan. Shikhar Dhawan, KL Rahul, Mohammad Shami, Jasprit Bumrah and Yuzvendra Chahal complete his XI.

163.title: 20-25 bullet wounds found on Sidhu Moosewala's body, including one on skull: Reports
163.article_body: Around 20-25 bullet wounds were found on Sidhu Moosewala's body, including one on the skull, reports stated following a post-mortem investigation conducted by five doctors. Moosewala's right elbow was broken due to bullet injuries, reports added. He sustained maximum bullets on chest and abdomen while two bullets on right leg, reports further stated.

164.title: CCTV footage of alleged Moosewala murder suspects at local dhaba in Punjab surfaces
164.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online which reportedly shows seven men who were allegedly involved in killing Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa on Sunday. According to Times Now, the suspects had breakfast at a local dhaba near Mansa, 5 km away from the crime spot. The video shows the seven men sitting at the dhaba.

165.title: Over 500 trees uprooted in Delhi due to heavy rains, strong winds
165.article_body: Over 500 trees were uprooted across the national capital as heavy rains and strong winds with speeds touching 100km/hr lashed Delhi on Monday evening. Delhi government agencies like Delhi Police, New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) received around 530 calls regarding uprooted trees between 4.30 pm and 9 pm on Monday. Central Delhi witnessed maximum numbers of tree falls.

166.title: DRI seizes red sandalwood worth ₹11.70 cr stored as 'assorted toiletries' in Guj
166.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) on Monday seized 14.63 metric tonnes of red sandalwood worth ₹11.70 crore from a consignment on the outskirts of Ahmedabad. The DRI officials had received a tip-off that the shipping container was labelled as "assorted toiletries" to dodge the authorities which was later verified through a physical search.

167.title: 3 Nigerian nationals held for cheating over 1,000 people: Delhi Police
167.article_body: Delhi Police said they arrested three Nigerian nationals for cheating over 1,000 people via matrimonial sites and social media in eight years. This comes after a woman filed a complaint claiming she had been cheated of ₹55,900. The accused would win over victims by saying they had either sent gifts or they were flying down for a meet, police added.

168.title: Navi Mumbai woman cheated of ₹7 lakh saved for daughter's studies
168.article_body: A 48-year-old woman in Navi Mumbai was cheated of ₹7 lakh by a cyber fraudster on the pretext of good returns on investment in overseas schemes. The woman, who had saved the money for her daughter's education, had gotten a call from the fraudster while searching for investment options. The fraudster had promised money would be deposited in her account.

169.title: He's gold for any team once he's fit to bowl: Ian Bishop on Hardik
169.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya following his performance in IPL 2022, Ian Bishop said, "By the way, Hardik is gold for any team once he's fit to bowl." The GT skipper took a total of eight wickets in this season, including three in the final in his side's seven-wicket win against RR. Hardik dismissed Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson and Shimron Hetmyer.

170.title: Govt probing ZTE, Vivo for alleged financial improprieties: Report
170.article_body: Corporate Affairs Ministry is probing the local units of China's ZTE Corp and Vivo Mobile Communications for alleged financial improprieties, Bloomberg reported. The ministry will scrutinise auditor reports and has received information that indicates potential violation, including fraud. Enforcement Directorate had last month seized Xiaomi Technology India's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore.

171.title: Delhivery's revenue more than doubles to ₹2,072 cr in Q4
171.article_body: Delhivery's revenue grew more than two-fold to ₹2,071.7 crore in Q4 FY22, compared to ₹1,002.6 crore in the year-ago period. Its net loss remained nearly flat at ₹119.8 crore, against a loss of ₹118 crore reported in Q4 FY21. Delhivery's net loss in FY22 rose from ₹415.7 crore in FY21 to ₹1,011 crore while its revenue rose to ₹6,882 crore.

172.title: Police clash with anti-government protesters in Armenia's capital
172.article_body: Armenian Police clashed with anti-government protesters in the nation's capital Yerevan on Monday. "We once again urge you to show exclusively lawful behaviour during public actions, to obey...lawful demands of the police officers," the police said. The clashes erupted amid demonstrations against PM Nikol Pashinyan over his handling of ties with Azerbaijan following a war in 2020.

173.title: Russia ready to facilitate grain exports from Ukrainian ports: Putin
173.article_body: Amid soaring food prices globally, Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday said that Russia is ready to facilitate the unhindered export of grain from Ukrainian ports. His comment comes amid a blockade of Ukrainian ports by the Russian forces. Separately, Putin said that if sanctions were lifted, then Russia could "export significant volumes of fertilizers and agricultural products".

174.title: 13 students wearing hijabs denied entry into K'taka's Mangalore University
174.article_body: As many as 13 students of Karnataka's Mangalore University were denied entry to their classes on Monday as authorities cited Karnataka High Court's order that had upheld the ban on hijabs. The students claimed the court's order pertained to pre-university colleges and not degree colleges. "I've...appealed to them to ensure peace in the college campus," Dakshina Kannada Deputy Commissioner said.

175.title: Suriya to help family of fan killed in accident in Tamil Nadu
175.article_body: Actor Suriya visited the house and paid tribute to a fan who met with an accident and died on the way to the hospital in Tamil Nadu.
