The 27-year-old named Jagadish was the Namakkal District Secretary of the Suriya Fan Club. The actor has reportedly promised to get a job for Jagadish's wife and help Jagadish's daughter complete her education.

176.title: Loved the story: Akshay on what made him say yes to film Samrat Prithviraj
176.article_body: When asked what made him say yes to the film 'Samrat Prithviraj', Akshay Kumar said, "I loved the story. Especially the guy who's making it, Dr. Chandraprakash Dwivedi and the way he narrates it and thinks about it." "Even if he writes one sentence, he must have read some 10,000 books on it, only then will he write," Akshay added.

177.title: Best moment in French Open 4th round was seeing Henry in stands: Fernandez
177.article_body: Canada's Leylah Fernandez, the 17th seed, said she's "enormously grateful" to be in the quarterfinals at French Open after her fourth round win over 27th seed Amanda Anisimova on Sunday. "Thankful for an amazing support system from the crowd's energy, family, friends and my team. But by far the best moment was seeing Thierry Henry in the stands," she added.

178.title: Ex-Prez Poroshenko leaves Ukraine to attend political meeting
178.article_body: Ex-Ukraine President Petro Poroshenko, who's under probe for treason, was permitted to leave the country to attend a political meeting in Netherlands' Rotterdam, his party said on Monday. Poroshenko, who crossed over to Poland via border crossing, had previously been denied permission to leave Ukraine on two occasions. Poroshenko has been accused of financing pro-Russian separatists from 2014-15.

179.title: How has your Madhya Pradesh grown so big: Mamata on belly of leader weighing 125kg
179.article_body: During a meeting West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee asked a TMC leader about his growing belly and said, "There is definitely some problem...How has your Madhya Pradesh grown so big?" After he said he exercises for three hours daily, Mamata asked him to demonstrate Kapal Bhati. The man said he weighs 125 kg.

180.title: 2 dead, several injured amid strong winds & heavy rainfall in Delhi
180.article_body: Two persons, aged 65 and 50, were killed and several injured after rains accompanied by strong winds lashed Delhi on Monday. The 50-year-old man died in Jama Masjid area after a portion of a balcony of a neighbouring house fell on him. The 65-year-old victim was homeless and he was resting on a footpath when a tree fell on him.

181.title: 32-yr-old French journalist killed while covering war in Ukraine
181.article_body: A 32-year-old French journalist, Frédéric Leclerc-Imhoff, was killed while working in eastern Ukraine's Luhansk region on Monday. "Frédéric Leclerc-Imhoff was in Ukraine to show the reality of the war," French President Emmanuel Macron said. French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna said, "France demands that a probe be carried out as soon as possible."

182.title: I never lose sleep over what others think of me: Tanishaa Mukerji
182.article_body: Actress Tanishaa Mukerji stated in an interview that she never has and never will lose her sleep over what other people think of her. The actress added that she is a "people's actor" and welcomes thoughts and suggestions but she will not accept any "prying". "Whenever I get to face a nasty troll, he or she stands blocked," Tanishaa said.

183.title: This is sansanikhez: Sonali on 'fake' reports of starring in Jr NTR's next
183.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre on Monday reacted to rumours that she will be a part of Koratala Siva's next project featuring Jr NTR. Dismissing the reports, Sonali said, "No, I don't know, please tell me about it...I have no clue about this, so this is fake news. Or if it is news, it hasn't reached me yet. This is sansanikhez."

184.title: Wankhede transferred to Chennai for alleged shoddy probe against Aryan Khan
184.article_body: Former NCB zonal director Sameer Wankhede who investigated the drugs-on-cruise case in which Aryan Khan was accused, has been transferred to the Directorate General of Taxpayer Services (DGTS) in Chennai. Khan and five others were recently cleared of all charges in the case and the Centre had ordered a probe against Wankhede for 'shoddy investigation' in the case.

185.title: Sri Lankan PM proposes inclusion of protesting youth in governance
185.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sunday said that protesting youth groups will be invited to be part of governance under political reforms he is proposing amid an economic crisis. A group of protesters, mainly young people, have camped outside President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office for over 50 days. They are demanding Rajapaksa's resignation over his handling of the crisis.

186.title: Where to party now 'Nehra ji': Harbhajan after GT's IPL 2022 title win
186.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate GT on their IPL 2022 title, Harbhajan Singh wrote, "Where to party now, [Ashish] Nehra ji? We'll do bhangra along with garba...Commendable play throughout the tournament. Kudos to the captain Hardik Pandya and the team." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "A title win for the Titans! Undoubtedly the most consistent team of the tournament."

187.title: Will host it for him: Neetu on paparazzo demanding reception for Ranbir-Alia
187.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor reacted after paparazzo Viral Bhayani expressed his disappointment over Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt not hosting a wedding reception. Neetu said that she wants to have a social reception for Viral Bhayani. "I don't like it when anyone is upset. I'll host a special reception only for him...but I don't want him to be unhappy," she added.

188.title: World Bank to disburse $700 mn to crisis-hit Sri Lanka: Reports
188.article_body: The World Bank will disburse $700 million to Sri Lanka by re-purposing the country's existing loans amid its ongoing economic crisis, media reports stated on Monday. This comes as the country is also seeking a bailout package from International Monetary Fund (IMF). Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of essential items, including food supplies, fuel, medicines and cooking gas.

189.title: Court, Constitution will decide Gyanvapi issue, BJP will accept: Nadda
189.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda on Monday said the Gyanvapi mosque dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi will be decided by the court and the Constitution. "BJP has always talked about cultural development," Nadda said, adding that the party will follow the verdict "in letter and spirit". He further said BJP's endeavour is to build a strong nation by taking everyone along.

190.title: I was proud to witness an artiste like you: Asim on Sidhu Moosewala's death
190.article_body: Taking to Instagram, ex-Bigg Boss contestant, Asim Riaz mourned the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. He wrote, "I remember when I was in Chandigarh you called me over for dinner, I came all the way to moosa pind just to see you and how proud I was to witness an artist like you...[it's] gonna stay with me forever."

191.title: Leading GT to IPL title opens door for India captaincy: Gavaskar on Hardik
191.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said Hardik Pandya's display of leadership qualities in GT's IPL 2022 title win has automatically opened the door for him to possibly become Team India captain in future. "There are three-four other names in the ring. I'm not saying he's the next in line. But for the selection committee to have that option is fantastic," he added.

192.title: Car used by Moosewala's killers to escape found abandoned in Punjab's Moga
192.article_body: The car that was used by singer Sidhu Moosewala's killers to escape from Mansa has been found abandoned in Punjab's Moga, police said on Monday. The white Alto car was checked by forensic teams which took fingerprints from it, police said. A glass and two water bottles were found in the car, they added.

193.title: Investors get richer by ₹10 lakh crore in 3 trading sessions
193.article_body: The wealth of equity investors increased by ₹10 lakh crore after the market indices jumped in the last three trading sessions. On Monday, the Sensex jumped 1,041 points to close at 55,926, taking the total three-day gains to more than 2,100 points. All sectoral indices ended higher on Monday amid firm global cues and the early onset of monsoon.

194.title: Full credit to Hardik for GT's win in IPL 2022: Brett Lee
194.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said "full credits" to Hardik Pandya for leading Gujarat Titans to the IPL 2022 title. He added, "The team has done brilliantly right from the start of...tournament under Gary Kirsten and Ashish Nehra. A big congratulations to them." Hardik scored 34 runs and took three wickets to help GT defeat RR by seven wickets.

195.title: Sameer Khetarpal appointed MD & CEO of Jubilant Foodworks
195.article_body: Former Amazon executive Sameer Khetarpal has been appointed as the MD and CEO of Jubilant Foodworks, the company said on Monday. Khetarpal launched and conceptualised several businesses like Amazon Fresh, Amazon Food and Amazon Pharmacy. He previously worked with McKinsey and Company, GE Capital and Hindustan Unilever. Jubilant Foodworks' net profit in Q4 FY22 fell 8.8% YoY to ₹96 crore.

196.title: Satyendar Jain arrested in 8-yr-old fake case as BJP losing in Himachal: AAP
196.article_body: AAP MP Sanjay Singh on Monday, while reacting to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest in a money laundering case, claimed the arrest was made because BJP is "losing in Himachal Pradesh". Singh claimed Jain was arrested in an "eight-year-old fake case" and was being "harassed". "BJP do not contest elections, they run away from elections," Singh added.

197.title: Unlikely monkeypox outbreaks will lead to a pandemic, says WHO
197.article_body: A World Health Organization (WHO) official on Monday said that the UN health agency doesn't expect monkeypox outbreaks reported globally to lead to a pandemic. Over 300 suspected and confirmed cases of monkeypox have been reported across the world. Notably, the WHO is considering whether these outbreaks should be assessed as a potential public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC).

198.title: 2021 runner-up Tsitsipas crashes out of French Open, loses to unseeded Rune
198.article_body: Fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas has crashed out of the French Open, after losing to unseeded Holger Rune in fourth round on Monday. The 19-year-old beat last year's runner-up 7-5, 3-6, 6-3, 6-4 in three hours one minute. Notably, Rune has become the first Danish man to reach the quarter-finals in tournament history. Rune will face eighth-seeded Casper Ruud in last-eight.

199.title: NATO's support for Ukraine is unbreakable: Spain PM amid invasion
199.article_body: Spain's PM Pedro Sánchez on Monday stated that NATO's support for Ukraine is "unbreakable" amid the latter's ongoing conflict with Russia. "Supporting Ukraine with determination is the only way to ensure that...Europe and the world we have built has a certain future," he added. Russian forces are trying to capture parts of eastern Ukraine, including Sievierodonetsk in Luhansk region.

200.title: Nushrratt Bharuccha performs Ghoomar with 6000 women, video surfaces
200.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha, who'll be seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari', reportedly broke a world record during the promotions of her film in Jaipur. The actress, along with her co-star Anud Singh Dhaka, performed Ghoomar with 6000 women. In videos shared by a paparazzo account, Nushrratt and Anud were seen posing with women dressed in traditional clothes for the Ghoomar performance.

201.title: Tried to prank Hrithik on 'Kaho Na...' sets, it backfired: Farah
201.article_body: Director-choreographer Farah Khan said she tried to prank Hrithik Roshan on the sets of 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai'. She added they gave him an intricate break-dance move thinking he'll get terrified. "He simply nodded and performed the dance! We were...stunned," Farah said. She added that she never thought the 'Ik Pal Ka Jeena' step would be remembered after 22 years.

202.title: Indian designers said no: Helly on wearing international designers at Cannes
202.article_body: Actress Helly Shah has revealed her manager approached many Indian designers when they started planning the trip to Cannes Film Festival. "When the time came, no one agreed to give me their outfits except a few designers. That's when we decided to approach international designers," she added. Earlier, Meera Chopra said designers only wanted to dress Deepika Padukone for Cannes.

203.title: Heavy rains, strong winds bring temperature down by 16°C in Delhi
203.article_body:
After rains coupled with strong winds lashed Delhi on Monday, the temperature fell by 16°C
in South Delhi's Safdarjung observatory and by 13°C at Palam observatory near the airport. "Between 4.20 pm and 5.40 pm, the temperature fell from 40°C to 25°C at Safdarjung," the India Meteorological Department said. Several trees were uprooted due to rains in parts of Delhi.

204.title: Made my own notes from newspapers: Civil services topper on preparing for exam
204.article_body: Shruti Sharma, who topped the UPSC Civil Services 2021, revealed her strategy for preparing for the prestigious exam. She said she made her own notes from newspapers and focussed on "answer writing practice for better presentation". The JNU alumna, who scored 340 out of 400 marks, said UP cadre is her first preference.

205.title: Jama Masjid's dome damaged after thunderstorm in Delhi; pic surfaces
205.article_body: The 10-foot-long finial atop the middle dome of the Jama Masjid was damaged after heavy rainfall and thunderstorm in Delhi on Monday. Syed Ahmed Bukhari, the Shahi Imam of Jama Masjid, said that two pieces of the finial had fallen, while another piece was still on the roof. "In some parts, stones also fell. Three people were injured," he added.

206.title: Will not send rocket systems to Ukraine that can reach Russia: US
206.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday said America will not send rocket systems to Ukraine that can reach into Russia. However, it was not clear which systems Biden was referring to in his remark. The Ukrainian government has urged the West to provide it with more longer-range weapons to fight the Russian forces invading the country, according to Reuters.

207.title: Attack on Tikait exposed BJP’s intellectual bankruptcy: Ex-K’taka CM
207.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Monday condemned the physical assault on Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait in Bengaluru and stated that the incident has "exposed BJP's intellectual bankruptcy". "Assault on...Tikait is a testimony to BJP's inability to face opponents on ideological basis," Siddaramaiah tweeted. Tikait was attacked with black ink at a press meet in the city today.

208.title: Ashish Nehra creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win IPL title as head coach
208.article_body: GT head coach Ashish Nehra has created history by becoming the first Indian to win IPL title as head coach. Nehra is also the fourth person after Shane Warne, Darren Lehmann and Ricky Ponting to win an IPL title both as player and head coach. He had won IPL title as a player while being part of SRH in 2016.

209.title: GT hold roadshow in Ahmedabad to celebrate IPL 2022 victory, pics go viral
209.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) held a roadshow at the Sabarmati Riverfront in Ahmedabad on Monday to celebrate their victory in IPL 2022. Scores of fans gathered on the streets for the roadshow. Earlier today, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel felicitated Gujarat Titans and presented a memento to their captain Hardik Pandya. GT had defeated Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the final on Sunday.

210.title: Pics show damages after heavy rainfall in Delhi as AC, hoardings, trees fall on cars
210.article_body: Several cars in Delhi were left damaged when trees, hoardings and an air-conditioner fell on them in separate incidents after heavy rainfall and hailstorm, accompanied by strong winds, lashed the city on Monday evening. As seen in visuals that have surfaced online, the canopy at the Vijay Chowk in Rajpath had also toppled during the thunderstorm.

211.title: It'll be a monumental effort for Nadal to win French Open: Auger-Aliassime
211.article_body: Ninth seed Felix Auger-Aliassime, who stretched Rafael Nadal to five sets before losing the 2022 French Open fourth round, said it'll be a "monumental effort" for the 13-time champion to win the title this week. He added that Nadal's quarter-final match against Novak Djokovic will be "difficult". Nadal beat Auger-Aliassime 3-6, 6-3, 6-2, 3-6, 6-3 in four hours 21 minutes.

212.title: 100 killed in clashes between gold miners in Chad last week: Govt
212.article_body: Around 100 people were killed in clashes between gold miners in northern Chad on May 23 and May 24, Defence Minister General Daoud Yaya Brahim said on Monday. About 40 others were injured in the clashes, he added. All people from the informal gold mining site in Kouri Bougoudi district are being evacuated, he further said.

213.title: 'Jersey' director once said 'Nobody will be interested in you': Shahid
213.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri told him after a shot that he is worried since the film is about him but nobody will be interested in his character. "He said, 'After seeing your dad (Pankaj Kapur's) take, you think anybody is going to look at you in the scene? He's so good'," Shahid added.

214.title: Apple's iPhone 14 Pro series could get 'Always-on Display': Report
214.article_body: Apple's iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max could get the 'Always-on Display' feature, Moneycontrol reported citing Bloomberg. The feature will allow iPhone to turn down frame rate significantly on the lock screen and display quickly glanceable information. The other features that the new iPhone Pro series models may have include an A16 chip and a 48-megapixel back camera.

215.title: I understand disappointment of those who didn't clear UPSC but they'll make a mark: PM
215.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday talked about UPSC civil services aspirants who couldn't clear the exam, saying, "I fully understand [their] disappointment." He added, "I also know that these are outstanding youngsters who will make a mark in any field they pursue and make India proud." The 2021 final exam results were declared on Monday.

216.title: 8 years of govt have been about fulfilling people's aspirations: PM
216.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said the last eight years of his government have been about fulfilling people's aspirations. "We are committed to fulfilling our pursuit of Seva, Sushasan and Garib Kalyan," PM Modi said. He shared a link to a section on the NaMo app that showcases his government's eight years of service through innovative ways.

217.title: China's Shanghai to lift 2-month-long COVID-19 lockdown on June 1
217.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai will lift the city's two-month-long lockdown from midnight on June 1. Reacting to the news, a Chinese social media user said, "I'm so emotional that I'm going to cry." "The epidemic situation in our city has been effectively controlled and the situation continues to improve," the Shanghai city government said in a statement.

218.title: Mann doesn't deserve to remain CM: SAD leaders to Punjab Governor
218.article_body: A day after Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leaders met Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit to seek the dismissal of CM Bhagwant Mann. "[Mann] is pushing [Punjab] back into...anarchy. We also demand NIA probe into...killing," SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted. Punjab government will set up a judicial commission to probe Moosewala's death.

219.title: No doubt RSS flag will become national flag one day: Eshwarappa
219.article_body: Former Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said there's no doubt that the RSS flag "will become the national flag someday". "To bring out the sense of sacrifice, RSS does prayers by keeping the saffron flag in the front," Eshwarappa said. "We don't have to hoist the tricolour whenever [Congress tells] us," he added.

220.title: I'm grateful for Malti, want to be a thoughtful father: Nick on daughter
220.article_body: Singer Nick Jonas revealed that after becoming a father the "weight of everything is much more intense". Speaking about his daughter Malti Marie, Nick said, "I think it's now about trying to be as present as possible and as thoughtful as you can be for your family." "I'm...grateful for [Malti] and the wonderful perspective of being a parent," he added.

221.title: Nigeria reports 1st death due to monkeypox this year, 21 cases
221.article_body: Nigeria has reported its first fatality due to monkeypox, along with 21 confirmed cases this year, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) said on Sunday. "The death was reported in a 40-year-old patient who had underlying co-morbidity and was on immunosuppressive medications," CDC added. Monkeypox infections have been reported in at least 23 countries so far, according to WHO.

222.title: After U-19 World Cup, winning the IPL is just as big: GT opener Gill
222.article_body: Following GT's maiden IPL title win, opener Shubman Gill said, "It means a lot. After winning the Under-19 World Cup, winning the IPL is just as big." Gill, who scored an unbeaten 45 off 43 balls, was the leading run-scorer for GT in their seven-wicket win against RR on Sunday. Gill scored 483 runs throughout the IPL in this season.

223.title: SpiceJet fined ₹10 lakh for using faulty simulator to train Boeing 737 Max pilots: Report
223.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Monday imposed a penalty of ₹10 lakh on private carrier SpiceJet, on the charge of utilising faulty simulator to train pilots of Boeing 737 Max aircraft, according to reports. The training imparted by SpiceJet using the faulty simulator could have "adversely affected flight safety", the DGCA reportedly stated.

224.title: If India need a captain in 2 years I wouldn't look past Hardik: Vaughan
224.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT to IPL 2022 title in their debut season, Michael Vaughan said "If India need a captain in a couple of years I wouldn't look past Hardik." He added it's a "fantastic" achievement for a new franchise. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 3/17 and 34(30) in the final against RR.

225.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain arrested by ED in alleged money laundering case
225.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was on Monday arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a money laundering case, officials said. The case pertains to hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company, the officials added. The agency had in April attached properties worth ₹4.81 crore linked to Jain, in connection with a money laundering case.

226.title: Union Minister Rijiju's daughter sings Rafi's song, video surfaces
226.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Monday took to Instagram to share a video of his daughter singing 'Yeh Hai Bombay Meri Jaan', a song sung by legendary singers Geeta Dutt and Mohammed Rafi. In the video, she can be heard singing the song along with another classic 'Oh, My Darling Clementine'. Union Minister Smriti Irani reposted the video on Instagram.

227.title: Anil Kapoor marks 25yrs of 'Virasat'; shares pics with Tabu, Pooja
227.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Monday took to Instagram to mark 25 years since the release of his film 'Virasat'. The actor shared a series of stills from the film, writing, "Dedicating the 25th Year of my personal favourite film Virasat to one of the best producers I have ever worked with! #MushirRiaz." The film starred Pooja Batra and Tabu.

228.title: Sudan lifts state of emergency imposed since last year's coup
228.article_body: Sudan on Sunday lifted a state of emergency that was imposed after a military coup in October last year. The decision was taken to create the right atmosphere to achieve stability during the transitional period, the Transitional Sovereign Council said. Separately, the Security and Defence Council had recommended the release of all detainees who were arrested under it.

229.title: Arguably the best team this season: Yuvraj on GT after their IPL 2022 win
229.article_body: Congratulating GT following their title win in IPL 2022, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Arguably the best team this season!" He added, "Outstanding tournament for Hardik Pandya and Shubman Gill. Not long before he [Shubman] gets into the T20 national side. Last but not the least Ashish Nehra ji hanste-hansate cup utha liya." GT won the title in their first-ever IPL season.

230.title: 7-yr-old girl found dead in Mumbai hotel; mother unconscious, father missing
230.article_body: A seven-year-old girl's body was found inside a hotel room in Mumbai's Mira Road area. Her mother was found unconscious and her father, who had checked in with them, is missing. According to police, initial investigations suggest that the father tried to kill his daughter and wife in the hotel, but the wife somehow managed to escape.

231.title: This isn't Afghanistan, it's not allowed to own guns: Karan on Moosewala's death
231.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra reacted to Sidhu Moosewala's murder and expressed grief. He said, "We tweet and mourn but a mother lost her son to such a horrific situation. I saw a few videos and the visuals were so gory that it would hurt your heart deeply." "It's not allowed to own guns just like that...This is not Afghanistan," he added.

232.title: BSP won't contest Rampur LS bypoll nor support anyone: Mayawati
232.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati said that party won't contest Rampur parliamentary constituency bypoll, nor will it support any other party on seat. She, however, added that BSP will contest Azamgarh bypoll with "full strength". Bypolls on these seats are being held as SP's Akhilesh Yadav and Azam Khan resigned as MPs from these seats after winning in 2022 UP Assembly polls.

233.title: Dalit staffer barred from using tumbler, toilet at TN govt office, 6 booked
233.article_body: Six employees of Tamil Nadu's Public Works Department have been booked under sections of the SC and ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act for allegedly harassing a colleague from the Dalit community. The victim was allegedly abused, restricted from using a tumbler that his colleagues used for drinking water, denied access to the toilet and barred from using the office computer.

234.title: Trees uprooted as heavy rains with strong winds lash Delhi; pics surface
234.article_body: Trees were uprooted in several areas of Delhi as heavy rains coupled with strong winds at a speed of 50 km per hour lashed the city on Monday. Trees were also uprooted at BJP MP Parvesh Verma's residence at Janpath Road, damaging his car. In Connaught Place, a car was trapped under an uprooted tree.

235.title: Lawrence Bishnoi moves court fearing encounter by Punjab Police in Moosewala murder
235.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's one of the prime suspects in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, has moved an NIA court fearing a fake encounter by Punjab Police. Bishnoi is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail and has sought to stop Punjab Police from gaining his custody. Bishnoi's gang member Goldy Brar is also a suspect in Moosewala's killing.

236.title: Newly-listed LIC's Q4 net profit falls 17% to ₹2,409 cr, declares ₹1.5 dividend
236.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Monday reported that its consolidated net profit fell 17% year-on-year to ₹2,409 crore in the quarter ended March 2022. The company earned a net premium of ₹1.44 lakh crore during the quarter, while its revenue increased to ₹2.12 lakh crore. LIC, which listed on the bourses this month, announced a dividend of ₹1.5.

237.title: Archie characters are iconic, I'm nervous making the film: Zoya
237.article_body: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar has stated in an interview that she is a little nervous making 'The Archies' because the characters from the comic books are "iconic and globally loved". The filmmaker further said, "I have to make sure the film stokes the nostalgia of a generation that grew up on the comic and yet resonates with young adults today."

238.title: Atul Kataria Chowk flyover opened to traffic from Gurugram to Delhi
238.article_body: The Public Works Department (PWD) on Sunday opened one carriageway of Gurugram's Atul Kataria Chowk flyover to traffic coming from Gurugram to Delhi. "The flyover is likely to become fully operational by June 15," said PWD Superintending Engineer (B&R) Parveen Chaudhary. The traffic coming from Delhi to Gurugram bus stand will continue to use the service lanes.

239.title: Delhi Police to question gangsters in Tihar for 'plotting' Moosewala's murder
239.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday said it will interrogate gang leaders lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail for allegedly plotting the murder of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala from inside the prison.  Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar has claimed responsibility for the murder and said it was planned by him and the Lawrence Bishnoi group. Bishnoi is currently lodged in Tihar jail number 8.

240.title: It's a promotion, not hike: Kartik on claim he'll charge ₹40cr after 'Bhool...' success
240.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has denied a report that claimed he has hiked his fees to ₹35-40 crore per movie after the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Calling the report "baseless", Kartik said, "Promotion hua hai life mein. Increment nahi (I've been promoted in life, haven't got an increment)." The film is this year's fifth Hindi movie to cross ₹100-crore earnings.

241.title: Left envelope with ₹1 lakh cash at vendor in Indore: Kamya Punjabi
241.article_body: Television actress Kamya Punjabi revealed in an interview that she was recently in Indore and went to try pani puri. She added that she had an envelope containing ₹1 lakh cash with her which she mistakenly left there. "My friend rushed to the place...[and] he found my packet at the spot where we had left it," the actress said.

242.title: Biggest celebration happened when I met my fans: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
242.article_body: Speaking about celebrating the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', Kartik Aaryan said he had gone to Gaiety Cinema in Mumbai. "My biggest celebration for the film happened on the first weekend of the release itself. I had gone to the Gaiety cinema and met the fans," he added. "I danced with them and asked them about the film," he said.

243.title: Need to examine if Uniform Civil Code affects human rights: Khurshid
243.article_body: Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Monday commented on the proposed implementation of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) by some states, stating the need to examine if UCC affects human rights. "Whether it is Uniform Civil Code or anything else, it must meet the requirements of...Indian Constitution," he added. Uttarakhand government has formed a five-member panel to prepare draft on UCC.

244.title: Man dressed as elderly woman throws cake at Mona Lisa painting in Paris
244.article_body: A man disguised as a wheelchair-bound elderly lady lunged and threw cake at the Mona Lisa painting, which was behind the protective bulletproof glass at the Louvre Museum in Paris. While being escorted by security guards, the man shouted, "Some people are trying to destroy the earth, think of the earth!" He also threw roses on the floor.

245.title: Once, a child called me Rahul Gandhi: Akhilesh in UP Assembly
245.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Akhilesh Yadav on Monday narrated an incident in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly from the time when he was the Chief Minister. "I asked a child if he knew who I was. The child said, 'Yes, you are Rahul Gandhi'," he said. Several leaders in the Assembly laughed over this.

246.title: 99% of pre-monsoon nullah-cleaning work complete in Mumbai: BMC
246.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed 99% of pre-monsoon nullah-cleaning work, according to official data. "Initially, work of desilting was going on at a slow pace but after contractors were penalised, the work began being carried out in full swing," an official said. "The remaining work will be completed in the next couple of days," the official added.

247.title: Sun Pharma posts ₹2,277 crore net loss in Q4 FY22
247.article_body: Sun Pharmaceuticals Industries on Monday reported a net loss of ₹2,277.38 crore in Q4 FY22, compared to the net profit of ₹894 crore a year ago. Its revenue from operations in Q4 rose 11% YoY to ₹9,446.76 crore. The firm's sales in India rose 16% YoY to ₹3,095.60 crore while its spending on research and development stood at ₹543.30 crore.

248.title: PM Modi's approval ratings rise to highest since the start of pandemic: Survey
248.article_body: Approval ratings of PM Narendra Modi's government have risen to the highest since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic at 67%, according to a survey conducted by LocalCircles, which polled 64,000 people. That's a jump from 51% last year and 62% in 2020 when the pandemic started. Around 73% said they were optimistic about their and families' future in India.

249.title: Parmeet's career had slow start: Archana on being more successful than husband
249.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh spoke about having a bigger career than that of her husband, Parmeet Sethi. She said Parmeet has been a mature person. "Although his career had a slow start, he has done good work in...films," she added. "He...established himself in his career but remained in the background, so it seemed...I did better in my career," Archana said.

250.title: 5 including minor drown in dam backwaters in Gujarat's Narmada
250.article_body: Five people drowned after they entered the backwaters of the Karjan dam in Gujarat's Narmada district. The deceased included an eight-year-old boy, his parents and another couple, police said. The incident, which took place near Mandan village, happened at 6 pm on Sunday but four out of the five bodies were recovered on Monday morning, police added.

251.title: Over 2,800 people arrested following 24-day drug bust in Brazil
251.article_body: Officials in Brazil's Sao Paulo on Sunday seized 13.6 tonnes of drugs and arrested over 2,800 people following a 24-day drug bust, which is part of government's 'Operation Choke' initiative. As many as 427 stolen vehicles were also recovered by police amid the ongoing anti-crime drive. The number of security personnel patrolling Sao Paulo's streets was reportedly hiked to 9,700.

252.title: My goal is to make films for families to watch: Kiara Advani
252.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani has stated in an interview that her goal is to make films now which warrant a community watching experience that families can go and watch. The actress further said that with success she has gained clarity and has found her own voice. Kiara added that playing unique characters was always on her wish list.

253.title: Align admission procedure to our policy: DU to St Stephen's College
253.article_body: Delhi University on Monday asked St Stephen's College to align its admission procedure with the university's policy. This comes after the college earlier said it'll accord 85% weightage to Common University Entrance Test's (CUET) score and 15% to physical interviews. Adding score based on an interview to the CUET score will "eventually lead to discrimination", said DU Registrar Vikas Gupta.

254.title: Saffron flag may become national flag someday: KS Eshwarappa
254.article_body: Former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said that the saffron flag didn't get its "respect today or yesterday", but that it has a "history of thousands of years". "The saffron flag may become the national flag...today or someday. There is no doubt in it," he added. Furthermore, he said that the saffron flag is "a symbol of sacrifice".

255.title: Custody of B'luru's Madiwala Lake handed over back to forest dept
255.article_body: After the Karnataka Forest Department made repeated requests to the state government, the custody of Madiwala Lake in BMT Layout in Bengaluru has been handed over back to the department. The lake's custody was with the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) since 2019. An official from Forest Department said, "We would like to start boating once again in the lake."

256.title: Rain, hailstorm lash parts of Delhi; flights affected, wind leaves cars shaking
256.article_body: Parts of Delhi witnessed a hailstorm and heavy rainfall on Monday evening, which led to disruption of traffic movement at several places in the city. Flight-tracking websites reportedly showed several passenger planes circling over Indira Gandhi International Airport, waiting for the weather to clear. As per reports, strong winds left cars shaking on roads.

257.title: Who were the highest wicket-takers in IPL 2022?
257.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal finished as the highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022. He picked up 27 wickets, the most by a spinner in a season in IPL history. RCB's Wanindu Hasaranga was the second-highest wicket-taker with 26 scalps. PBKS' Kagiso Rabada took 23 wickets, the most by a fast bowler in the 15th edition of IPL.

258.title: Traffic policeman killed, 4 injured as car falls into river in J&K
258.article_body: A traffic police personnel died and four of his relatives were injured after the car they were travelling in skidded off the road and plunged into a river in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch, police said. The car was completely damaged in the accident, an officer said. A case has been registered and further investigation is underway, he added.

259.title: AAP workers report illegal sand mining in Punjab village; 4 booked
259.article_body: A sarpanch and three others were booked for allowing illegal sand mining in Punjab's Shampur village after AAP workers filed a complaint in the matter. The complainants also made a video of sand being illegally transported, a mining inspector said. The mining inspector added that following the complaint, he visited the village and found that the crime had taken place.

260.title: 6 suspects in Sidhu Moosewala's murder detained from Uttarakhand: Reports
260.article_body: As many as six suspects in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala have been detained from Uttarakhand, according to reports. The 28-year-old singer was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa in broad daylight on Sunday. More than 20 bullets were fired at the singer's car when he was travelling with his friends.

261.title: 2 booked for illegal fuel sale in Punjab; 18,000 litre fuel seized
261.article_body: The police have recovered at least 18,000 litres of illegally stored fuel, including petrol and ethanol, and three oil tankers following a raid in Punjab's Sangrur. A case was also filed against two people in the matter, district SSP said. Earlier, police had also seized 8,050 litres of illegally stored petroleum products from roadside eateries and yards in the district.

262.title: Man, son booked for beating dog to death in Maharashtra's Thane
262.article_body: A man and his son were booked by the police for beating a stray dog to death in Thane's Ulhasnagar township in Maharashtra. The accused allegedly hit the dog continuously despite efforts being made by the neighbours to stop the duo, police said. The incident's video was made by some locals and was later posted on social media platforms.

263.title: MP bank employee arrested for raping colleague for 3 yrs on pretext of marriage
263.article_body: Police have arrested a private bank employee from Bhopal for allegedly raping his colleague for over three years on the pretext of marrying her. The duo was posted in one branch in Indore, a police official said. In 2019, the man got transferred to Bhopal. The first incident occurred when the woman visited him for bank-related work in Bhopal.

264.title: I'm single, maybe I'll always be a bachelor like Salman Khan: Faisal Khan
264.article_body: TV actor Faisal Khan, while talking about his relationship status, said, "I'm not seeing anyone...I'm single." He said he doesn't want to date anyone right now, adding that he's happy with his life. "I want to be Salman Khan of...TV industry. I'll maybe always be a bachelor like him," Faisal, who currently appears on the show 'Dharm Yoddha Garud', said.

265.title: It's difficult to change teams, cities: PSG's Neymar on Lionel Messi
265.article_body: PSG forward Neymar Jr, speaking about Lionel Messi's first season with the club, has said, "It didn't take long at Barcelona, he stayed there for many years, it's difficult to adapt." Messi scored six goals in Ligue 1. "It's difficult to change teams, cities...There's also the style of play with players who...don't understand the way he plays," he added.

266.title: 3 Hyd tourists drown in Abbey falls near Bengaluru, bodies recovered
266.article_body: Three tourists from Hyderabad drowned in the Abbey falls near Kodagu district near Bengaluru on Sunday. Reports said that the incident took place when one of them slipped and fell into water. The other two drowned after they jumped in to save him. Police said that the bodies have been recovered and handed over to the relatives of the deceased.

267.title: Mumbai court convicts 45-yr-old man in Sakinaka rape-murder case
267.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai on Monday convicted 45-year-old Mohan Chauhan in the rape and murder case of a woman in Sakinaka in September last year. The sessions court will pronounce the quantum of punishment on June 1. Chauhan had raped the woman in a stationary vehicle and inserted a rod in her private parts.

268.title: Knew it would do well: Kartik on Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success
268.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, speaking about the box office success of his horror-comedy movie 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said, "During a time like this, having delivered a 100 crore collection within...first 9 days of release...is the most surreal feeling." "I knew [it'd]...do well, but couldn't have imagined it like this," he added. 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has earned ₹122.69 crore in India so far.

269.title: There's scope of improvement in all areas in RR: Sangakkara on RR's loss
269.article_body: Following RR's seven-wicket loss against GT in IPL 2022 final, RR head coach Kumar Sangakkara said the team needs a lot of improvement in all areas. Notably, RR opener Jos Buttler (863 runs) finished as leading run-scorer, while leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal ended as the highest wicket-taker (27 wickets) in IPL 2022. Chasing 131, GT scored 133/3 in 18.1 overs.

270.title: David Miller's batting was the biggest surprise this IPL season: Manjrekar
270.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said GT batter David Miller's form in IPL 2022 was the biggest surprise of the season. He added, "All the other seasons had proved to be a failure for Miller. He suddenly stepped up while playing for a new franchise...It was his best IPL season." Miller scored 481 runs in 16 games in the tournament.

271.title: Am I less deserving?: Congress' Nagma after being denied RS seat
271.article_body: After Congress leader Nagma was denied a seat in the Rajya Sabha polls, she asked, "[Imran Pratapgarhi] is accommodated in Rajya Sabha from Maharashtra. I ask am I less deserving." The actor-turned-politician said, "Sonia ji, our Congress president had personally committed to accommodating me in RS in 2003/04 when I joined Congress party on her behest."

272.title: Gaming unicorn Mobile Premier League to fire 10% of its workforce
272.article_body: Bengaluru-based gaming unicorn Mobile Premier League is laying off 100 employees, representing about 10% of its workforce, Moneycontrol reported. In an email to employees, the startup's Co-founders Sai Srinivas Kiran G and Shubh Malhotra wrote, "The philosophy of growth at all costs is now reversed." Fired employees will receive complete severance along with other benefits, as per the email.

273.title: Don't underestimate Kung Fu Pandya: Natasa on husband Hardik Pandya's IPL win
273.article_body: Natasa Stankovic celebrated with her husband, cricketer Hardik Pandya after his team Gujarat Titans won the IPL 2022 final on Sunday. Natasa shared a video of Hardik from a recent interview, where he's talking about how he was shaping his IPL team to be like him. Alongside it, she wrote, "This man and this team...Don't underestimate my Kung Fu Pandya."

274.title: Pune civic body collects ₹750-crore property tax in 2 months
274.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has collected property tax worth ₹750 crore in the first two months of the financial year, officials said. It is ₹190 crore more than the previous year's collection of ₹560.34 crore during the same period, the in-charge of PMC's property tax department said. Around five lakh property owners have paid their taxes so far.

275.title: I haven't read wife Tahira's book on our sex life: Ayushmann
275.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has stated that he has not read his wife Tahira Kashyap's book 'The 7 Sins of Being a Mother'. Tahira has included details about their sex life in the book. Ayushmann said, "As a reader, it may be entertaining but personally, I am a very private person...I don't like talking about my private life."

276.title: Mohali man sends obscene messages to woman's family as she refuses to marry
276.article_body: Police booked a man from Mohali's Zirakpur for sending "obscene messages" to the friends and family of a woman after she refused to marry him. She met the accused while searching for a job. Accused's mother proposed his marriage to the woman, which she refused, the woman said. Later, the man started sending obscene messages to her family and friends.

277.title: Death toll due to floods, landslides in Brazil reaches 57
277.article_body: The death toll due to the floods and landslides caused by heavy rains in Brazil has reached 57. While 56 people died in Brazil's Pernambuco state, one person was reportedly killed in the rain-hit neighbouring state of Alagoas. Thousands of people have reportedly been displaced. Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has announced a relief of one billion Brazilian real.

278.title: 7 stranded trekkers rescued from height of 4,500 metres in Uttarakhand
278.article_body: An Indian Air Force chopper on Monday rescued seven trekkers who were stranded at height of 4,500 metres in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag since Friday. Reports said the trekkers had run out of food and water and were rushed to ITBP hospital for a check-up after being rescued. Five of them are from Uttarakhand while two are from Delhi and Uttar Pradesh.

279.title: U'khand to screen Char Dham pilgrims aged above 50 after 101 deaths
279.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has announced that people aged above 50, who are planning to take the Char Dham yatra, will have to undergo mandatory health screening. The state government took the decision after two people died on Sunday while undertaking the yatra, taking the death toll to 101. "The pilgrims found medically unfit...are being advised to return," Rudraprayag CMO said.

280.title: KRK says Kiara deleted tweet congratulating him because of Sidharth
280.article_body: Kamaal R Khan on Monday tweeted that Sidharth Malhotra made his rumoured girlfriend, actress Kiara Advani, delete a congratulatory tweet for him. He shared a screenshot showing Kiara's tweet wherein she congratulated him on his biography 'Controversial KRK'. "Kiara...deleted it after 10 minutes...When I asked her reason, she said...Sidharth got angry and asked her to delete [it]," KRK wrote.

281.title: Told cameraman 'I'm your boss' after he opted to take orders from Farhan: Zoya
281.article_body: Zoya Akhtar, recalling the shooting of her directorial debut 'Luck by Chance', revealed that "certain technicians" used to ask the lead actor, Farhan Akhtar, if the shot was okay as he was an established filmmaker. "I [told a]...Steadicam operator, 'We...[can't]...work together if you won't speak to me.' He responded, 'But...you're like my sister.' I said, 'I'm your boss!'," Zoya added.

282.title: N Korea lifts COVID-19 movement restrictions in Pyongyang: Report
282.article_body: North Korea has lifted movement restrictions in Pyongyang after the country confirmed its first COVID-19 outbreak weeks ago, Japan's Kyodo News reported quoting a source. This comes as North Korea's state media reported that the issue of "effectively" coordinating and enforcing the anti-epidemic regulations given the "current stable situation" was examined by the Political Bureau.

283.title: Jos Buttler was very timid vs GT in IPL 2022 final: Vaughan
283.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said RR were "timid" in their approach against GT in the IPL 2022 final, which they lost by seven wickets. "I felt Jos Buttler was very timid. He was waiting for the bad ball, wasn't on the front foot trying to dislodge the bowlers off the length," added Vaughan. Buttler got out after scoring 39(35).

284.title: Serbia secures 'very favourable' gas deal with Russia
284.article_body: Serbia secured a "very favourable" deal with Russia to procure natural gas, President Aleksandar Vucic said. This comes despite calls from European Union (EU) nations to impose sanctions on Russian fuel supplies over war in Ukraine. "The free leader, free people make decisions that are good for Serbia and do not accept orders" from the West, said Serbian Interior Minister.

285.title: I've been through that many times in career: Finch on his lean patch
285.article_body: Australia's limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch, speaking about his batting form, said it has been a "reasonably" lean patch. He added that he has been through such form "plenty of times" in his career. He stated a "busy schedule" should help him come back in form. Finch scored 133 runs in six T20Is and 23 runs in three ODIs this year.

286.title: India has become one of the fastest growing economies in world: PM
286.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that coming out of the negative impact of COVID-19, India has become one of the fastest-growing economies in the world. India trusted its scientists, doctors and youth during the COVID-19 pandemic and did not become a problem but was a solution-giver for the world, PM added.

287.title: Truck hits parked minivan in Andhra Pradesh, 6 killed, 10 injured
287.article_body: A minivan parked on the side of the road was hit by a truck in Rentachintala village located in Andhra Pradesh's Palnadu district. The minivan, which was carrying over 30 passengers, overturned after it got hit. Six people were killed in the accident while 10 others got injured, police said. Notably, the deceased were aged between 35 to 70 years.

288.title: Israel warns against Turkey travel after Iranian colonel's killing
288.article_body: Israel on Monday warned its citizens against travelling to Turkey, citing revenge threats from Iran following the assassination of a senior Revolutionary Guards Colonel. Iran, which has blamed Israel for Colonel Sayyad Khodai's murder, is looking to harm Israelis in "high-risk" Turkey, Israel's National Security Council stated. Khodai was shot dead outside his residence in Tehran on May 22.

289.title: Deepika Padukone-backed startup FrontRow fires 30% staff over email
289.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup FrontRow has fired 145 employees, nearly 30% of its workforce, over an email citing a funding crunch. A report also said that another 150 employees resigned following the layoffs, bringing down the company’s total employee count to about 100. The startup counts Deepika Padukone's Family Office, Vishal Dadlani and Unacademy's Gaurav Munjal among its investors.

290.title: Sidhu Moosewala got threats from gangsters 4 years ago: Mika Singh
290.article_body: Singer Mika Singh has revealed in an interview that Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala used to talk about receiving threats from gangsters four years ago. He added, "Some gangsters might have tried to extort money from him this time." Mika further said that Sidhu told him he could roam freely in Mumbai without any security.

291.title: Moosewala's family being forced to get done last rites soon: Punjab Cong chief
291.article_body: The family of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead, is being forced to get the post-mortem and last rites done soon, Punjab Congress chief, Amarinder Singh Raja Warring, said. "Why was security withdrawn when there was a threat perception and it was made public?" Warring added. Moosewala's family earlier refused to allow post-mortem on his body, reports said.

292.title: Story of Raajneeti was incomplete; it will have a sequel: Prakash Jha
292.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha said that his film 'Raajneeti' will have a sequel. "Raajneeti is the only project where [the] story was incomplete so it will surely go into [a] sequel," he added. Jha further said that the sequel to Raajneeti is all set to be shot in Lucknow and they have already zeroed on the locations as well.

293.title: Consultation paper on crypto fairly ready: Economic Affairs Secy
293.article_body: Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth on Monday said the consultation paper on cryptocurrencies is "fairly ready". "We've gone through deep dive, consulted not just domestic stakeholders but also organisations like the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank," Seth said. He added that the government is also beginning work on some sort of global regulations on cryptocurrencies.

294.title: T'gana minister attacked with chairs, stones by mob at public meeting
294.article_body: Telangana minister Chamakura Malla Reddy was allegedly attacked by an angry mob at a public meeting in Hyderabad on Sunday. Reddy was forced to leave the venue after the crowd allegedly started hurling chairs, water bottles and stones at him. The incident took place when Reddy praised the state government for various development and welfare programmes taken up in Telangana.

295.title: Russia suffered devastating losses among lower-ranked officers: UK
295.article_body: The UK on Monday said that Russia's military appears to have suffered devastating losses amongst mid- and junior-ranking officers in Ukraine. The loss of younger officers was likely to exacerbate Russia's problems in modernising its military command and control, it added. The ministry also claimed that there were multiple credible reports of localised mutinies amongst Russia's forces in Ukraine.

296.title: Match against Djokovic will be big challenge: Nadal on French Open QF match
296.article_body: Ahead of his French Open quarter-final match against Novak Djokovic on Tuesday, Rafael Nadal has said that it will be a "big challenge" for him. "I didn't play this kind of match for the last three months...Probably, he (Djokovic) will be confident. I know how my situation is, and I accept it well. I'm gonna fight for it," Nadal said.

297.title: Top 3 scorers of UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021 are women
297.article_body: The first three toppers of the UPSC Civil Services Examination, 2021, are women candidates. Of the 685 candidates who have qualified the exam, Shruti Sharma was declared the topper. Ankita Agarwal has ranked second, followed by Gamini Singla, who secured the third rank. Aishwarya Verma and Utkarsh Dwivedi were among the top five scorers.

298.title: Marcelo, who won record 25 trophies with Real Madrid, confirms leaving club
298.article_body: Brazilian defender Marcelo has announced that he'll be leaving Real Madrid, bringing an end to his 15-year-long stint with the Spanish club. Marcelo stated that he has played his last game for the club as he lifted his fifth and Madrid's 14th Champions League trophy on Saturday. The 34-year-old has won a record 25 trophies in total at the club.

299.title: 3 detained for throwing ink at farmer leader Rakesh Tikait in B'luru
299.article_body: Three people have been detained for throwing black ink at Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait at an event in Bengaluru on Monday, police said. The incident took place during a press conference. After the ink attack, Tikait said, "No security was provided by local police here. This has been done in collusion with the government."

300.title: Sensex jumps 1,041 points to end at 55,926, Nifty closes above 16,650
300.article_body: BSE Sensex jumped 1,041 points or 1.90% to close at 55,926 while NSE Nifty surged by 309 to settle at 16,661 on Monday. Titan, Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Reliance Industries and TCS were among the lead gainers. Meanwhile, Ethos made its market debut today and ended at ₹802 per share, 8.6% down from its issue price of ₹878.

301.title: PM Modi congratulates students for clearing UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021
301.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated students who cleared the Civil Services (Main) Examination, 2021. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi wrote, "My best wishes to these youngsters who are embarking on their administrative careers at an important time of India's development journey, when we are marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav." JNU-alumna Shruti Sharma topped the examination.

302.title: They fired indiscriminately at my son from Corolla and Bolero: Moosewala's father
302.article_body: In his FIR, Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh said he saw a Corolla car with four occupants trailing his son's Thar and later a Bolero which was also carrying four youths stopped in front of his son's vehicle in Mansa. The occupants of the Corolla and Bolero started indiscriminate firing, Singh said. "Within minutes, the cars sped away," he added.

303.title: Still in shock, can't believe what has happened: Jasbir on Moosewala's death
303.article_body: Singer Jasbir Jassi, while condoling the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, said, "I'm still in shock and...can't believe...what has happened." "He was the only child and I cannot even begin to imagine what [his parents]...must be going through," he added. Jasbir further said Moosewala was extremely intelligent and had a "terrific knowledge about sound".

304.title: Will ask RR players to use this IPL final loss to achieve more: Buttler
304.article_body: After losing the IPL final on Sunday to Gujarat Titans, Rajasthan Royals batter Jos Buttler has said that he will ask his RR teammates to use "this hurt to achieve more in future". "I have lost plenty of finals in my career. It has been an absolute privilege to play in front of a big crowd (in Ahmedabad)," Buttler said.

305.title: Liverpool fans responsible for initial chaos at CL final: French Minister
305.article_body: France Sports Minister Amelie Oudea-Castera has held Liverpool fans without tickets responsible for the initial problems at the recent Champions League final. "(This) was a mass gathering of...(Liverpool) supporters without tickets," Amelie said. "When there are that many people by the entrance...there will be people trying to force their way in through the (stadium's) doors," she added.

306.title: Who is Shruti Sharma, JNU alumna who topped UPSC Civil Services 2021 exam?
306.article_body: Shruti Sharma from Uttar Pradesh's Bishnoi secured All India Rank 1 in the UPSC Civil Services 2021 exam. Sharma graduated from St Stephen's College of Delhi University and then got her postgraduate degree from Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) in Delhi. The history student prepared for UPSC at Jamia Millia Islamia Residential Coaching Academy.

307.title: Who were the highest run-scorers in IPL 2022?
307.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler top-scored in IPL 2022 with 863 runs in 17 innings. Buttler's tally of runs is the highest by an overseas player in an IPL season. LSG captain KL Rahul, who was the third-highest run-getter in IPL 2021, finished as the second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2022 with 616 runs. Rahul's teammate Quinton De Kock was the third-highest run-scorer.

308.title: Liberating Donetsk, Luhansk is Russia's unconditional priority: Lavrov
308.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Sunday said that the "liberation" of Donetsk and Luhansk regions in Ukraine's Donbas is an "unconditional priority" for Moscow. He added that the Russian Federation recognises the two regions as "independent states". Earlier, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba called Russia's offensive in Donbas "the largest one on European soil since World War II".

309.title: Punjab govt to set up judicial commission to probe Sidhu Moosewala’s killing
309.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has announced to set up judicial commission under the sitting judge of Punjab and Haryana High Court to investigate the killing of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. The singer's father had earlier written to CM Mann saying that his son left forever due to the government's failures.

310.title: Sidhu Moosewala's murder plot suspected to have links to Tihar Jail
310.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's murder plot is suspected to have links to Tihar Jail in Delhi, Hindustan Times reported while quoting a Delhi policeman. The officer said that a phone number has been traced to Tihar. He added that an arrested criminal named Mohammad Shahrukh was using a messaging app to communicate with gangster Goldy Brar, who claimed responsibility for the murder.

311.title: Fan compares Soni's 'Mandi' look to Alia's 'Gangubai...', she responds
311.article_body: Actress Soni Razdan has responded after a fan shared a clip of her from 1983 film 'Mandi' comparing her look as a sex worker to daughter Alia Bhatt's in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. The fan wrote, "Both have tremendous resemblance, both are best actresses. Soni then looks ditto Alia of now." Soni replied, "Oh gosh a blast from the past all right!"

312.title: UP bride refuses to marry groom after he fails to arrange photographer
312.article_body: A bride in Uttar Pradesh refused to marry after the groom forgot to bring along a photographer. She later went to her neighbour's house. "The man who didn't care about our marriage today, how is he going to take care of me in the future?" she said. Police claimed both parties returned the goods and cash given to each other.

313.title: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband arrested for drunk driving
313.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul Pelosi, was arrested for allegedly driving under the influence of alcohol in Napa County. He was booked on two counts - driving under the influence and driving with a blood alcohol content of 0.08% or higher. He was granted bail after paying $5,000, according to the public booking report.

314.title: My son Jehangir is a part of 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Kareena Kapoor
314.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan, taking to Instagram, shared the trailer of her film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Along with the trailer, she wrote, "One of my most special films...also because my Jeh (Jehangir) baba is very much a part of it (in my tummy)." She further thanked Aamir Khan and director Advait Chandan for having both, Jehangir and her, in the film.

315.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz enters maiden French Open quarters
315.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz reached his maiden French Open quarter-final after a 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 win against 21st seed Karen Khachanov on Sunday. Notably, the 19-year-old became the youngest male player in 29 years to reach two Grand Slam quarter-finals after also reaching the 2021 US Open last-eight. Sixth-seeded Alcaraz will next face third-seeded Alexander Zverev.

316.title: Fire at cargo complex in Mumbai airport; 3 fire trucks, 2 tankers sent
316.article_body: A tarpaulin shed at the cargo complex inside Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport caught fire on Monday. The fire brigade team reached the spot and was able to douse the fire. The Mumbai Fire Brigade reportedly sent three fire trucks and two jumbo tankers. Mumbai Fire Brigade chief officer said that a monsoon shed at the airport had caught fire.

317.title: I'm still in disbelief: Rahul Vaidya on Sidhu Moosewala's demise
317.article_body: Singer Rahul Vaidya mourned the demise of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. Speaking about it, Rahul said, "The news was so bad [that] I am still in disbelief. I've seen some pictures of his mother and I don't know what to say...It's high time such incidents should not happen in our country. Rest in peace, Sidhu Moosewala."

318.title: Johnny Depp joins Jeff Beck's concert for surprise performance in UK
318.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp joined Jeff Beck's concert in UK's Sheffield for a surprise performance on Sunday ahead of the verdict of his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Pictures and videos of his performance are going viral on social media. Depp sued Heard over her 2018 op-ed article in which she wrote she is a "public figure representing domestic abuse".

319.title: 'She said I was mistake?' Saif on Sharmila calling him spontaneous child
319.article_body: Reacting to his mother Sharmila Tagore calling him a spontaneous child, Saif Ali Khan jokingly said, "Does that mean...she had me spontaneously? It's like a borderline mistake. She said I was a mistake?" In a 2012 interview, Sharmila had said, "Saif was a...beautiful baby, he was a beautiful boy too...He was impulsive, spontaneous, and could grasp a situation at once."

320.title: Loan agent blackmails Hyd woman with morphed nude photos; arrested
320.article_body: A 23-year-old loan agent was arrested by Hyderabad Police for allegedly morphing photos of a woman and blackmailing her with them. The accused, Manish Kumar, allegedly sent morphed nude photos to victim after she failed to pay her EMIs for loan she had borrowed on an instant loan app. Kumar had also been sending abusive messages to victim, police said.

321.title: Metro rail work causes traffic jam at Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai
321.article_body: A traffic jam was witnessed on Monday morning at the Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai due to the ongoing metro rail work. "Huge traffic at eastern highway...5-6 km long jam from Mulund towards Kanjurmarg," a motorist tweeted. The dismantling of a crane at the site near JVLR junction in Vikhroli got delayed which led to the vehicular traffic, police said.

322.title: 20 mini-forests to be developed in densely-populated areas in Delhi
322.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is planning to develop at least 20 mini-forests in densely populated areas in the city. As per data released by the corporation, the horticulture wing of the civic body will plant saplings of 85,000 trees and 5,20,000 shrubs this year. As many as 17 mini-forests were developed in the city last year.

323.title: Someone said our team wasn't good after mega auction: GT's Saha after winning IPL 2022
323.article_body: After winning IPL 2022 by defeating Rajasthan Royals (RR), Gujarat Titans (GT) wicketkeeper-opener Wriddhiman Saha said, "Someone said our team was not good after the auctions, but we proved them wrong." He added that it was his fifth final and the second final which he won. GT defeated RR by 7 wickets in the final.

324.title: Hyd Archbishop Anthony Poola to be 1st Telugu & Dalit Cardinal
324.article_body: Archbishop of Hyderabad, Anthony Poola, is the first Telugu and Dalit man who will be elevated to the rank of Cardinal of the Catholic Church by Pope Francis. Poola, a native of Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district, is among 21 other churchmen who will be ordained as Cardinals by Pope. The ceremony will be held on August 27 in Vatican City.

325.title: People will never know what Punjabi artists deal with daily: AP on Moosewala's death
325.article_body: Singer AP Dhillon took to Instagram to react to Sidhu Moosewala's death, saying he was "praying for his family". Dhillon said, "Most people will never know...what you've to deal with as a Punjabi artist...on a daily basis, with constant judgement, hate-filled comments, threats...directed toward people like us." He added, "I...admired how Sidhu was able to rise above it all."

326.title: 18-year-old model found dead in Kolkata, 3rd such incident in a week
326.article_body: An 18-year-old model and make-up artist, Saraswati Das, has been found dead at her residence in Kolkata. "It seems that it's a case of suicide, but we need to look into other angles too," police said. This is the third such incident within a week after the death of models Manjusha Neogi and Bidisha De Majumdar.

327.title: Winning IPL is the biggest achievement of my career: GT's Rashid Khan
327.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan said winning the IPL 2022 is the biggest achievement of his career. "You always want to do well in big competitions like this," he added. "Winning tournaments like this, you'll need to put in...hard work and this is certainly a high point of my career," he stated. GT defeated RR by 7 wickets in the final.

328.title: Rakesh Tikait attacked with ink, people throw chairs at one another at B'luru event
328.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait was attacked with black ink during a press conference in Bengaluru. "No security has been provided by the local police here. This has been done in collusion with the government," the farmer leader alleged. Following the incident, people were purportedly seen throwing chairs at one another in a video that has surfaced online.

329.title: Muslims won't accept interference in Islamic laws: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on UCC
329.article_body: The Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind (JUH) passed a resolution against Uniform Civil Code (UCC), saying that Muslims will not accept any kind of interference in Islamic laws. "The government in power is determined to implement the UCC…and is trying to neglect the real spirit of the Constitution," the resolution said. Issues like marriage, divorce and inheritance are guided by religion, it said.

330.title: Portion of ceiling collapses at Pune Fire Brigade's central station
330.article_body: A part of the ceiling of the main building of the Central Fire Station in Pune collapsed on Monday. As per reports, nobody was at the spot when the incident took place, but two firemen were standing nearby. This comes days after a portion of the ceiling of the control room of Pune Fire Brigade had collapsed.

331.title: Oil price crosses $120 mark ahead of EU meeting on Russia sanctions
331.article_body: Oil price crossed the $120 mark on Monday, climbing to its highest in over two months, ahead of European Union's meeting which could lead to a ban on Russian oil imports. Brent crude futures was up 47 cents to $119.90/barrel after rising to $120.50/barrel earlier in the session. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures jumped 72 cents to $115.79/barrel.

332.title: Shubman Gill's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting IPL 2022-winning six goes viral
332.article_body: A video of GT opener Shubman Gill's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting a six to win IPL 2022 final for his team against RR has gone viral. Gill took off his helmet and let out a roar after slamming the match-winning six. Gill finished the match unbeaten on 45 off 43 balls.

333.title: Up to ₹13 cr briefly credited in 100 HDFC accounts in Chennai due to technical error
333.article_body: HDFC Bank froze around 100 accounts in Chennai after these accounts were credited with a few thousand rupees to ₹13 crore. The bank attributed this to a technical error which was noticed in a few customer accounts after a routine upgrade on Saturday. While the hold was released a few hours later, several users took to Twitter about the same.

334.title: Trapped in scams before 2014, India now achieving new heights: PM
334.article_body: India was trapped in scams and nepotism before 2014 but it is achieving new heights now, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "Corruption, scams...nepotism…the country is getting out of the vicious cycle in which it was trapped before 2014," PM added. "The heights that India has achieved in the last eight years, no one could have imagined earlier," he stated.

335.title: 1 killed, 5 injured in IED blast in community hall in Manipur
335.article_body: One person died in an IED blast that took place in a community hall in Manipur on Monday. The blast took place at Sapam Mayai Leikai in Khongjom. Five people were injured in the incident. Police said that the area has been cordoned for forensic inspection. The injured were taken to Thoubal Hospital.

336.title: Bengaluru reports over 200 new COVID-19 cases after nearly 3 months
336.article_body: Bengaluru reported over 200 new COVID-19 cases after nearly three months with 232 cases, according to BBMP data published on Sunday. The data showed that the city reported no new deaths due to the virus and that the positivity rate is at 1.2%. The number of active COVID-19 clusters in the city is five, the data also showed.

337.title: Had GT lost another wicket in first 8-9 overs, they would've been in trouble: Sehwag
337.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said that GT didn't score much in the first eight-nine overs while chasing RR's 130-run total in IPL 2022 final and had they lost another wicket at that time, they would've been in trouble. "But Hardik Pandya's innings was crucial, may seem small on paper, but those 34 runs were very important," Sehwag added.

338.title: Vodafone Idea shares jump on report that Amazon may invest ₹20,000 crore
338.article_body: Shares of Vodafone Idea rose sharply on Monday after The Ken reported that American e-commerce giant Amazon may invest up to ₹20,000 crore in the telecom service provider. The company's shares jumped to an intraday high of ₹9.45 on the NSE. As per The Ken, Amazon had carried out due diligence on Vodafone Idea in the first quarter of 2021.

339.title: I never called Moosewala gangster, says Punjab DGP after singer's father demands apology
339.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra on Monday said that he condemned in the "strongest terms" the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, adding that he never called him a gangster. This comes after Moosewala's father wrote a letter to Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann, seeking an apology from the Punjab DGP for relating his son's murder to gang war.

340.title: Hardik is humble, was eager to learn as captain: Gary Kirsten
340.article_body: After winning the IPL 2022, Gujarat Titans coach Gary Kirsten has said that captain Hardik Pandya showed eagerness to learn in his first IPL season as a captain. "He's (Pandya) a high-profile player in India but he's incredibly humble, wanting to learn as a leader and engage with his players which I think is really, really important," Kirsten said.

341.title: Rajya Sabha has become a parking lot: Congress' Manish Tewari
341.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Monday said that the Rajya Sabha has now become a "parking lot". "In my personal opinion, Rajya Sabha has stopped carrying out the functions for which it was constituted," Tewari added. It needs to be examined whether or not the country needs the Rajya Sabha now, the Congress leader stated.

342.title: 30 traffic signals at busy Pune junctions dysfunctional for over 20 days
342.article_body: Thirty traffic signals have not been functioning for over 20-25 days at the busiest junctions in Pune, leading to traffic congestion. "Some signals are not working due to the ongoing metro and drainage pipeline work, while others have technical faults," DCP (Traffic) said. "The repair work of signals is underway and work will be completed soon," a civic official said.

343.title: Batting at no. 4 is perfect position for Hardik in T20Is: Vettori
343.article_body: Ex-New Zealand skipper Daniel Vettori said Hardik Pandya batting at number four for Team India in T20Is is a "perfect position" for him. "You don't want to take anything away from...Suryakumar Yadav. But, if this option's there, it'll be great," he stated. He added Hardik might play at number five "as of now" with Rishabh Pant dropping to number six.

344.title: They could've done a lot of things differently: Harbhajan on RR's defeat
344.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said RR could have done a lot of things differently in the IPL 2022 final against GT, which they lost by seven wickets. "Firstly, I felt they should have chased...They should have strung partnerships; 160 runs are enough in a final. They did not bat well...GT was the better team," stated Harbhajan.

345.title: Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands Group in talks to acquire Ted Baker: Report
345.article_body: US-based Authentic Brands Group, owner of brands like Forever 21 and Reebok is reportedly in talks to acquire Ted Baker. Shares of Ted Baker rose 3.1% on Monday following this report. It added that the two companies could agree on a £300 million deal for the same. British fashion retailer Ted Baker had put itself up for sale in April.

346.title: Nitesh Tiwari, Ashwiny announce new project 'Bas Karo Aunty!'
346.article_body: Filmmaker couple Nitesh Tiwari and Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari have teamed up with Star Studios, Ronnie Screwvala and Siddharth Roy Kapur to produce film 'Bas Karo Aunty!'. Based on Varun Agarwal's book 'How I Braved Anu Aunty and Co-Founded a Million Dollar Company', the young-adult comedy-drama will be directed by Abhishek Sinha and it'll feature Ishwak Singh and Mahima Makwana.

347.title: Dad bought 'Zanjeer' script from Dharmendra for ₹3,500: Prakash Mehra's son
347.article_body: Late filmmaker Prakash Mehra's son Puneet Mehra said that his father had bought the script of 'Zanjeer' from actor Dharmendra for ₹3,500. Puneet said his father loved the script and Dharmendra was to play lead role in the movie. However, the actor was busy for a year. Prakash did not want to wait since he thought people would forget him.

348.title: Nottingham Forest get promoted to the Premier League after 23 years
348.article_body: Nottingham Forest will be returning to the Premier League after 23 years after the football club defeated Huddersfield Town 1-0 in the Championship playoff final. The match took place at Wembley on Sunday. Huddersfield defender Levi Colwill scored an own goal in the match. Along with Nottingham, Fulham and AFC Bournemouth have been promoted to the Premier League.

349.title: 10 lakh smart meters to come up to beat electricity reading errors in Mumbai
349.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport, which also provides electricity connection along with the bus transportation service in Mumbai, has decided to install 10 lakh smart meters to tackle electricity reading errors. The smart meters will be enabled with 4G and 5G SIM cards. Consumers can track their usage and recharge them similar to that of mobile phones, officials said.

350.title: 'Godman' allegedly rapes woman on pretext of curing her son in Pune
350.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 60-year-old self-proclaimed godman for allegedly raping a 36-year-old woman. The accused had done so under the pretext of performing rituals to cure her son's physical disability and improve the family's financial condition. The incident occurred when the accused went to the woman's house and reportedly forced her to disrobe under the guise of "a spell".

351.title: UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021 final results declared, Shruti Sharma tops exam
351.article_body: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the final results of Civil Services Examination, 2021.
