Shruti Sharma has topped the examination, while Ankita Agarwal and Gamini Singla secured the second and the third rank, respectively. A total number of 685 candidates have been recommended for appointment, according to an official press release.

352.title: My son left forever due to govt's failure, his mother asks when he'll return: Sidhu's father
352.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has written a letter to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann after his son's murder. He wrote, "Due to failures of your government, my son left us forever." He added, "Shubhdeep's mother asks me where is her son and when will he return home. What answer should I give her? I hope I will get justice."

353.title: Key accused in Assam police station fire 'accidentally' run over by escort vehicle, dies
353.article_body: The man, Ashikul Islam, who was accused of inciting a mob to set the police station in Assam's Nagaon on fire was killed as an escort vehicle "accidentally" ran over him on Monday, police said. Reports said he was trying to run away from police custody. Three police personnel were also injured in the incident.

354.title: Absolutely devastating: Lilly Singh mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
354.article_body: YouTuber-comedian Lilly Singh took to Instagram to mourn the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Absolutely devastating and upsetting news," Lilly wrote while adding, "Through his revolutionary music, he'll live on. Beyond the care he had for his community, he created the soundtrack that made many of us feel seen, a perfect blend of hip hop, rap and folk music."

355.title: Peru to open criminal investigation into President Pedro Castillo
355.article_body: Peru's Public Ministry announced on Sunday that National Prosecutor Pablo Sanchez will open a preliminary investigation into President Pedro Castillo over alleged crimes like peddling, collusion and criminal organisation. The investigation, which was initially opened against a former minister and six congressmen, will now include Castillo due to the "seriousness" of the accusations, it said.

356.title: Cong will go with collective leadership in Gujarat polls: Mevani
356.article_body: Congress backed independent MLA Jignesh Mevani has said that the party will go with a "collective leadership" in this year's Gujarat Assembly polls. However, Mevani cleared that he is not among the contenders to become CM if Congress wins the polls. "Gujarat's people are aware of the situation...during the COVID-19, the performance of the Gujarat government was pathetic," Mevani said.

357.title: Hardik cleaned up RR's heart, heartbeat, kidney in the final: Aakash
357.article_body: Ex-India batter Aakash Chopra, speaking about GT skipper Hardik Pandya's three-wicket haul versus RR in IPL 2022 final, said, "Hardik cleaned up the heart, heartbeat and kidney." Aakash added, "The captain came to the forefront in the grand finale, when do you get to see that many times?" Hardik dismissed Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler and Shimron Hetmyer in the match.

358.title: Man accused of raping stepdaughter dies in police custody in Delhi
358.article_body: A 40-year-old man, accused of raping his stepdaughter, died in police custody in Delhi. Denying allegations of custodial assault, the police said that the man was beaten up by the locals before he was arrested and that might have caused his death. The police said they took the man to the lock-up only after the doctors had discharged him.

359.title: Punjab CM orders inquiry into Moosewala's security cut, agrees to judicial probe
359.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday ordered an inquiry into the decision to reduce security of singer Sidhu Moosewala. Further, Punjab government will request Chief Justice of Punjab and Haryana High Court to get the murder case inquired into by the sitting judge of the High Court, Chief Minister's Office said. This comes after Moosewala's father wrote to CM Mann.

360.title: Will sell my clothes to provide cheapest wheat flour to people: Pak PM
360.article_body: Amid a wheat shortage, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif gave an ultimatum to the CM of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province asking him to reduce the price of a 10 kg wheat flour bag to ₹400 within the next 24 hours. Sharif said if the CM failed to do so, "I would sell my outfits and provide the cheapest wheat flour to people."

361.title: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Pulwama
361.article_body: Two local terrorists were killed in an encounter by the security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Monday, said police. The encounter started in the Gundipora area on Sunday based on the inputs received from Kulgam Police. According to Kashmir Zone Police, two terrorists belonging to JeM, including the killer of Constable Reyaz Ahmad, were trapped.

362.title: It defines the law & order situation in Punjab: Kangana on Moosewala's killing
362.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Monday to express grief over the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. "This is a sad incident," she wrote, adding, "This incident defines the law and order situation in Punjab." Moosewala was shot dead by unidentified assailants in a village in Mansa.

363.title: Moosewala's mother criticises Punjab CM outside hospital after son's murder
363.article_body: A video of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother Charan Kaur criticising Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann outside the civil hospital in Mansa, where her son was declared dead, is being widely circulated on social media. Reports said that Moosewala's mother blamed Punjab government and demanded justice. Notably, Moosewala's security was reduced a day before he was shot dead.

364.title: It stared, we had nowhere to hide: Guj farmer on finding lion on house roof
364.article_body: A farmer, who found a lion on the roof of his house in Gujarat while he and his family were sleeping, said that the lion stared at his family and his cattle and that they had nowhere to hide. "We kept flashing torches at the lion but it refused to climb down the roof," the farmer added.

365.title: Drake shares pic of Sidhu Moosewala with his mother, writes 'RIP Moose'
365.article_body: Canadian rapper Drake took to his Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district on Sunday. Sharing a picture of Moosewala with his mother, Drake wrote, "RIP Moose." As per police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder.

366.title: He was getting extortion & threat calls from Lawrence Bishnoi gang: Moosewala's father
366.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, was "getting extortion and threat to life calls from Lawrence Bishnoi gang and others", according to an FIR filed by his father Balkaur Singh. Moosewala had bought a bulletproof Toyota Fortuner in the wake of these threats but left home without his SUV and gunmen on Sunday, the FIR added.

367.title: Somebody trying to test new govt's red lines: Manish Tewari on Moosewala's killing
367.article_body: Following Punjabi Singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, Congress leader Manish Tewari said it's obvious that somebody is trying to test the red lines of the new government. "Since the new government was formed in Punjab, there have been a series of unfortunate incidents...If peace of a border state gets disturbed then it can have various implications," Tewari added.

368.title: We'll meet Shah if we don't get justice: Punjab Cong chief on Moosewala's killing
368.article_body: After Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa, state Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said the party will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah if they don't get justice. "We will go to high court and will meet the Governor," Warring added. "It needs to be investigated under a sitting judge and the NIA," he stated.

369.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family seeks CBI and NIA probe into his murder
369.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family has sought a CBI and NIA probe into his murder. His father wrote to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, saying that a CBI and NIA probe is must. The family has also sought action against officials who leaked the list of individuals who were stripped of security cover. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

370.title: Parking rates reduced at Noida's Sector 18 market, starts from ₹10
370.article_body: After constant demands from traders and customers, the Noida Authority has reduced the parking rates in Noida's Sector 18 market. The reduced rates will be implemented on both, surface and multi-level parking lots. Four-wheelers and two-wheelers will now be charged ₹20 and ₹10 respectively for 30 minutes while for up to four hours, it will be ₹50 and ₹25 respectively.

371.title: Bad day for music industry: Diljit Dosanjh on Sidhu Moosewala's death
371.article_body: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh reacted to singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's demise. Taking to Twitter, Diljit wrote, "The boy had a lot of talent. I never met him but his hard work spoke for him. This is hard for the parents." "It's a very bad day for the music industry," he added. Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

372.title: Daughter refuses to believe I voiced Maui, says 'you're The Rock': Dwayne
372.article_body: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson has shared that his four-year-old daughter Tiana "refuses to believe" that he had voiced a character from one of her favourite Disney films. "She still refuses to believe her daddy is...MAUI from one of her favourites, MOANA! She always says, 'Daddy, you're not Maui, you're The Rock'," he added. The animated movie was released in 2016.

373.title: RR need a batter who's a little more consistent than Riyan: Manjrekar
373.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said RR, who lost IPL 2022 final to GT, currently have 80-90 per cent of the "right team" for the next IPL season. Manjrekar added, "They need a batter who's a little more consistent than...maybe Riyan Parag and can also bowl two-three overs." Riyan scored 183 runs in 14 innings in IPL 2022.

374.title: Tata Motors signs MoU with Gujarat govt for acquisition of Ford's Sanand plant
374.article_body: Tata Motors has signed an MoU with the Gujarat government for the potential acquisition of Ford India's Sanand plant, it said in a regulatory filing. The agreement includes a transfer of Ford India's land, buildings, vehicle manufacturing plant, machinery and transfer of all eligible employees. As per a report, Tata Motors would pay $100-150 million for the plant.

375.title: 1 killed, 7 wounded in shooting at Oklahoma festival in US
375.article_body: A 39-year-old woman was killed and seven other people were wounded in a shooting that took place at an outdoor festival in US' Oklahoma. "Bullets were literally flying everywhere," said an eyewitness. According to the witnesses, the shooting was preceded by an argument. A 26-year-old man has been taken into custody, said the authorities.

376.title: Kamal meets Rajinikanth ahead of Vikram's release, director shares pics
376.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan met actor Rajinikanth ahead of the release of his film 'Vikram'. The film's director Lokesh Kanagaraj and producer R Mahendran also met Rajinikanth. Lokesh, taking to Twitter, shared pictures of the meeting and wrote, "Thank you Kamal sir! Rajinikanth sir! What a friendship! Inspiring." Actors Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil also feature in the film.

377.title: Zelenskyy fires Kharkiv security chief for 'not working to defend city
377.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that he dismissed the head of Security Service in Kharkiv for "not working to defend the city from...first days of a full-scale war, but thinking only of himself". However, he praised the army, police, city's Mayor and regional state administration for "working very effectively". Zelenskyy had visited the city on the same day.

378.title: 14 bodies found at Nepal plane crash site, official says 'Suspect all 22 died'
378.article_body: Fourteen bodies have been recovered so far in Mustang, Nepal where Tara Air plane carrying 22 people including four Indians crashed on Sunday. "We suspected all the passengers on board the aircraft have lost their lives. Our preliminary assessment shows no one could have survived the plane crash, but official statement is due," said a spokesperson in Nepal's Home Ministry.

379.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father followed him with 2 policemen in another car, saw his killing
379.article_body: Punjab Police have registered an FIR in connection with Sidhu Moosewala's killing at Sadar police station in Mansa on the statement of his father Balkaur Singh. Singh said he was witness to the fatal attack on his son. Singh "took both police security personnel in his car after he learnt that Moosewala had left home without guards", the FIR said.

380.title: Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims: Uttar Pradesh minister
380.article_body: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims and no one's constitutional rights are being violated. "We've to listen to the voice of common Muslims," Ansari added. "Today, they want to progress that was not done by previous governments, like, SP, BSP and Congress. They only used Muslims as a vote bank," he stated.

381.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family refuses to allow post-mortem on his body: Reports
381.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's family has refused to allow post-mortem on his body, reports said. This comes after senior police officials held discussion with the late singer's family. The family members have sought NIA probe into the murder and action against officials who leaked the list of individuals who were stripped of security cover

382.title: Prices of tomatoes may soon cross ₹100 per kg in Pune: Traders
382.article_body: As tomato prices have crossed the ₹80 per kg mark in several areas of Pune, traders reportedly said that the price would soon cross ₹100 per kg. Reports said that lower than expected plantation is the main reason for price rise. For the last three years, farmers have reportedly blamed the tomato mosaic virus for loss of produce.

383.title: Children who lost parents to COVID-19 to get ₹4,000 per month: PM Modi
383.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday announced that children who lost their parents to COVID-19 will be provided ₹4,000 monthly through various schemes to meet their daily requirements. Releasing the benefits under the PM CARES for Children scheme, he added, "If someone needs an education loan for professional courses, for higher education, then PM CARES will help in that too."

384.title: People love Hardik because of things he does on field, not off the field: Sehwag
384.article_body: Questioning GT captain Hardik Pandya's critics, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said the all-rounder "stood apart across all three departments" in IPL 2022 and people love him "because of the things he does on the field, not off the field". Sehwag added, "The personality off the field does not matter, it is absolutely irrelevant...it makes no impact on the field."

385.title: France to euthanise killer whale suffering from black fungus
385.article_body: The French authorities have decided to euthanise an orca, also known as killer whale, stranded in the Seine river, after efforts to save it failed. The officials believe that the animal is suffering from mucormycosis or black fungus and is critically ill. A group of experts concluded that it was best to put the animal out of its misery.

386.title: US Prez, First Lady visit site where 21 were killed in shooting
386.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden visited the school in Texas where 21 people, including 19 children, were killed in a shooting. The Bidens paid respects to the deceased at the memorial site at Robb Elementary School and attended a church mass. People outside the church urged Biden to "do something". "We will," replied President Biden.

387.title: Another Tara Air plane crashed on same Nepal route in 2016 killing 23 passengers
387.article_body: In 2016, a Tara Air plane carrying 23 passengers from Pokhara to Jomsom in Nepal lost contact and was later found crashed, killing all passengers on board. While the total time of the flight was 19 minutes, it lost contact eight minutes after taking off. The wreckage of the Tara Air flight with 22 passengers was found on Monday.

388.title: PM gives guidance to world but is silent on violence in Andhra: Raut
388.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi gives guidance to the world but is silent on occasions like violence in Andhra Pradesh over renaming of Konaseema district after Dr Ambedkar. "Modi is leading the nation with the maximum number of unemployed people and...he attends events on world stage," he added.

389.title: Ranveer Singh, Varun Dhawan condole Sidhu Moosewala's demise
389.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Varun Dhawan took to their respective social media handles to express condolences on the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "RIP. Your words and music will live on. Can't believe this," Varun wrote. Meanwhile, Ranveer shared a picture of Moosewala with a caption that read, "Immortal." Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

390.title: I am Hindu but not fool, we don't make religion an event: Kamal Nath
390.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath said religion is not the basis of politics. "We don't consider religion as the basis of our politics. We don't make religion an event," Nath added. "I proudly say that I am Hindu but I am not a fool…Our religion is an event of our family, it's not an event of politics," Nath stated.

391.title: He can influence people without even trying: Naga on 'Laal...' co-star Aamir
391.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who'll be making his Bollywood debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', opened up about his experience while working with Aamir Khan. "One thing is for sure that, what I've learnt in last 12 years, I learnt from him in 45 days," he said. "He's got this amazing magic that he can influence people without even trying," Naga added.

392.title: 3 killed, 9 injured after lightning strikes eatery in Chhattisgarh
392.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and nine others were injured in a lightning strike in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur on Sunday, police said. According to preliminary information, lightning had struck an eatery at a weekly market, the district Additional SP Pratibha Pandey said. Meanwhile, state CM Bhupesh Baghel announced ₹4 lakh each as compensation to the deceased's families.

393.title: Civic body to remove illegal gates of housing societies in Ghaziabad
393.article_body: In a move to free public roads, the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has decided to remove illegal gates of non-gated housing societies. "The corporation has not given any permission...and...movement of public cannot be restricted," an official said. "There are many societies in Shalimar Garden, Rajendra Nagar...who do not allow gates to be opened up for the public," a resident said.

394.title: Gleam on the face of this man tells he will die young: Moosewala sang in 'The Last Ride'
394.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala in one of his last songs 'The Last Ride' sang, "Moosewala has become immortal in his life, but the gleam on the face of this man tells that he will die young." Moosewala said in interviews that his inspiration was Tupac Shakur (known as 2Pac), the American rapper who too was shot dead in his car in 1996.

395.title: The fire could be heard in the village for a few minutes: Moosewala murder witness
395.article_body: An eyewitness at Jawahar Ke village where Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead has said, "The fire could be heard in the village for a few minutes." He added, "A white car came from behind and then drove parallel to Moosewala's car before opening fire...Then the white car drove up ahead and opened fire from the front."

396.title: 'I will live here and I will die here', Moosewala told voters at his village during polls
396.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala promised voters while campaigning during Punjab polls that he will always be there in his ancestral village. "I am not going anywhere. I will live here and I will die here," he would tell voters during the campaign in February. Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, had fought Punjab elections for Congress from Mansa seat.

397.title: He'll have to think about bowling more off spin: Sangakkara on Ashwin
397.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said Ravichandran Ashwin needs to think about bowling more off-spin deliveries. "Even for Ashwin, being a legend in terms of what he has achieved...there will be a lot of thinking and improvements to do," stated Sangakkara after their seven-wicket defeat against GT in IPL 2022 final. Ashwin registered figures of 3-0-32-0 against GT.

398.title: Sensex jumps over 900 points to 55,792, Nifty above 16,500
398.article_body: BSE Sensex rallied over 900 points to trade at 55,792 while the Nifty50 advanced 258 points to 16,611 during Monday's early trade. While Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Wipro and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were among the top Sensex gainers, shares of IRCTC rose nearly 5% in early trade ahead of its earnings to be announced today.

399.title: India may face power crisis in July-Aug amid coal shortage: Report
399.article_body: A report by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA), an independent research organisation, has suggested India may face a power crisis in July-August amid a coal shortage. As per CREA, the coal power plants cannot "address even a minor spike in the power demand" while it predicted a peak power demand of 214 GW in August.

400.title: After Ram Temple in Ayodhya, looks like Kashi & Mathura waking up too: UP CM
400.article_body: The temple town of Kashi appears to be waking up, as are Mathura, Vrindavan, Vindhyavasini Dham and Naimish Dham, after the construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "In this situation, we all have to move forward once again," CM Yogi added. His remarks came amid legal proceedings over the temple-mosque issues in Varanasi and Mathura.

401.title: JD(S) workers, farmer leader Kodihalli's supporters clash in B'luru
401.article_body: JD(S) workers and supporters of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha leader Kodihalli Chandrashekar clashed in Bengaluru as the farmer leader arrived at the Press Club to address corruption charges raised against him over KSRTC workers' protests. The JD(S) workers had raised slogans and reportedly tried to stop Chandrashekar from entering the Press Club. Chandrashekar had joined AAP recently.

402.title: India reports 2,706 new COVID-19 cases, 25 deaths in last 24 hours
402.article_body: India has reported 2,706 COVID-19 cases, 2,070 recoveries and 25 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,828 COVID-19 cases and 14 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,698, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,611.
